I was planning on taking friends there tomorrow morning for brunch but we'll be going elsewhere.

This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to one of our favorite neighborhoods in Charlotte, Plaza Midwood, and to Zada Jane's Corner Café. This beachfront themed café advertises a menu that is half vegetarian and half meat. Although breakfast is their focus and served all day, their lunch menu includes sandwiches, salads, and many unique sides, and their dinner menu is full of delicious options.  Dora here. This place has been on our list since we visited The Workman's Friend directly across the street and gawked at the crowded patio. Today was no different. The place was jammed with a thirty-minute wait. Service was friendly and attentive and more than welcoming, even if we were among the oldest ones there.  For my lunch, I chose the South of NO North omelet, which included country ham, caramelized onions, green chilies, cheddar cheese and covered with homemade salsa and served with a side of stone ground grits and a homemade TLC biscuit. This omelet was great and worked together perfectly with the onions and chilies to bring this dish to the next level. The salsa added a little heat, and when combined with the grits, made a wonderful bite.  Dora here. The Vegless Avenger, an omelet packed with meats (bacon, country ham, turkey sausage, chipotle chicken and chorizo) along with a healthy dose of cheddar cheese popped with flavor. The egg was light yet held up to all five meats. Typically I'm not a meat-lover when it comes to omelets or pizzas, but the chipotle chicken and chorizo combination intrigued me. One bite led to two and three, and don't you know I ate that whole thing! And the biscuit with apple butter, oh my goodness! I'm trying to cut back on all these carbs, but that biscuit made it tough. The sweet potato hash didn't do much for me. Probably because I prefer my sweet taters loaded with butter and brown sugar. lol.  Still Dora. Fair warning. The inside of Zada Jane's is extremely LOUD. Don't go there expecting to enjoy a quiet morning coffee. Not gonna happen. Not even outside. lol. Also, for parking, they have a small lot behind the restaurant, but don't bother. There's ample parking in a lot kitty corner across the street. You can thank us later. What's your favorite omelet?  We rate this restaurant 4 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving great food. ~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog

Called beforehand and was told there wouldn't be a wait at 10:30am (on Saturday) - arrived at 10:30am and waited about 30 minutes. However we did have a party of 7.5 so the wait was understandable. There was not a whole lot of space to stand and we were somewhat rudely asked to move more than a couple times, not the most pleasant waitresses. Foodwise: I ordered the biscuit, happy egg with cheese and a side of French toast. I was a little surprised at the length of time it took until we were able to order our food (it was busy at the restaurant but not THAT busy). Eggs were delicious, biscuit with homemade raspberry jam was stellar. I was however disappointed with the French toast, the toast was great but the menu indicated a slice of French toast and apparently that actually translates to a half a slice of French toast... My friends really enjoyed the breakfast sandwich, the bunny rancheros, the basic breakfast and the pancakes - not the sweet potatoes. Unfortunately, we were charged for the coffee we were offered while we waited that they said was complimentary.

Came here to meet a couple friends and the waitress was very quick to put together two tables and umbrella's to block the sun. She was fantastic and friendly. Parking can be tricky, so I parked across the street in the lot, but sometimes it's full and I wouldn't have known where else to park in that case. One friend had an omelette and salad and enjoyed it, while the rest of my friends had dessert. Carrot cake and pistachio bread pudding was what they had the day we came. I tried the carrot cake and it was my favorite carrot cake I've had. I do not like carrot cake because it's always either too dry or too sweet, but this one was really good and didn't have big chunks of walnuts like others I've tried. It tasted so fresh and was the perfect constancy. Their coffee and latte's are also really good, served in a cute home-y mug. I like the outdoor patio and the neighborhood vibe.

There is nothing like moving across a city to help you discover places you should have been going since the re-location.  Zada Jane's was exactly that for me on this past rainy Saturday afternoon.  My bf and I stopped in, were promptly seated, and soon I consumed one of those meals that you swear you would eat again three hours later, in its entirety.  The Bunny Racheros....where, oh where, have you been all my life?!?!  I am a huevos rancheros fan anyway and this one takes it to a whole 'nother level, seriously.  Black beans, fried eggs, pepper jack cheese sauce, cilantro crema, turkey sausage....I'm salivating just thinking about it.  It was so, so good!  My boyfriend had a "vegless avenger" omelet, which to me is gross due to the excessive amount of meat, but he said it was "okay" but he would not order it again.  Take from that what you will.  The biscuits were as promised....fluffy and full of TLC.  I also had an enormous vanilla latte which was damn near perfect.  I can see how this place could get crowded, and no, our service wasn't the fastest, but for a chill Saturday, it was perfect.  I imagine this will be our weekly stop from now on.  As Kevin put it, "Pancake House who??"

Finally came to Zada Jane's for dinner, as opposed to my normal obsession with their breakfast food. My fiancee and I have used 2 Groupons in the past year here, woohoo for coupons!   My first dinner venture was the Roasted Wild Mushroom Ravioli. I would probably give it 3.5/5 starts. Really good and tasty, but nothing special.  My second dinner visit I chose the The No-Da Salad. This will be what I order like, basically every time in the future. As a vegetarian it's hard to find a hearty salad with lots of protein and this salad goes above and beyond. The base is a spring mix with baked marinated tofu, tomatoes, hard boiled egg, artichoke hearts, avocado, roasted corn, white cheddar cheese, sunflower seeds, sprouts. Ahhh! Amazing!   My fiancee ordered the Ashley Farms Free Range Chicken entree. Other than his usual love, the Belvedere, this is currently his favorite thing he's ordered. It comes with a side of smashed potatoes and green bean casserole.   Oh, I almost forgot, on our last visit we ordered the Nachos as an appetizer. These were a little different than your normal nachos because they're served in a bowl, rather than a plate. Of course I love that they're vegetarian. The queso is what's up though. Mmmm! These black tortilla chips are also piled with grilled veggies, black beans, guacamole, romaine lettuce, sour cream, corn, and salsa. Will definitely order again.  The service this last time was great. The owner even came over and chit chatted a while. This is not always the case. I'd say, 1/3 of the time we get unlucky and get bad service. But luckily this isn't always and the food makes me forgive.

The food had a nice flavor to it. And I enjoy the fact that they serve breakfast all day. On the negative side of things; the wait to be sat was way too long. The server was mediocre at best and the food was cold by the time that it got to us!

Vegans rejoice - Zada Janes has a great tofu scramble, along with traditional brunch options (i.e., meat). You can finally sip mimosas again with your omnivore friends! The scramble is delicious and innovative with Indian curry - not too spicy and definitely not your run-of-the-mill scramble. I docked the rating a star, however, because their regular menu leaves a lot to be desired for vegans.

I try to write exclusively positive reviews, but -   On one occasion, I waited over an hour to sit. On another, I ordered food and waited an hour, and left without a manager or waiter addressing the unusually long wait. The food doesn't exactly make up for it.    Dish,  down the street,  does breakfast on Saturdays.  Food's better,  service is excellent,  and it's less expensive.
I've only ever gotten the omelets here, they're hit or miss and can get pretty pricey if you build your own. But their chai tea latte is to die for.

LOVE this place!!!! Definitely a neighborhood gem. I usually went here for breakfast when I lived in Charlotte...great food, very good service and unique/eclectic decor. Usually gets pretty busy on the weekends, but worth the wait!! They have numerous vegetarian options, which is always nice.
Food is mediocre and service is okay, but it took over 40 minutes to food and they were dead. DO not go there!

When I first moved to Charlotte in 2009, this place was my favorite.  It's still really solid and I'd like to give it 3.5 stars, but 4 is too many because there were a few visits where we had less than ideal waiters.  The food has always been good, it's unique, local and delicious.

It pains me to write this review, but am so disappointed with how this restaurant has gone downhill over the years.  We used to love this place but the last several times we have gone there we found the food to be mediocre, and the service to be excessively long.   Not sure what may have changed over the last year or so, but I sure wish it hadn't.  We won't be returning any time soon.

I love that I could bring my pups here! Had a large, delicious breakfast with my boyfriend one day outside. Not a lot of shade, so it can get hot. Food was really good, but menu is not extensive so not the best for picky eaters since everything is very different. Great place for large groups!

This quaint cafe absolutely deserves better credit than its current rating. Another understated and quaint spot that seems to be a staple of its neighborhood has both great ambiance with a lively staff and delicious food to back it up (with vegetarian vegan and gluten free options as well). While enjoying my brunch I sat at the bar and got talking to the bartender and another staff member (Tabitha and Courtney y'all are the absolute best) and they made me feel loved like a regular right away. Additionally, I got the Bunny Rancheros with chorizo for brunch (with an extra side of queso because treat yo self) and WOW was my stomach happy. If you're looking for a casual, delicious, and welcoming way to start off your day, there is no doubt in my mind this is the spot. Not enough cafes like this exist anymore. So happy to have been able to go while visiting.

I was extremely disappointed in my first visit to Zada Jane's. It definitely did not live up to the hype everyone makes it out to be. Ever since I moved to Charlotte, several people had told me you have to go to Zada Jane's in Plaza Midwood. It must be more for the name than anything else. We ended up leaving and not even eating there. After waiting 30 minutes for our food (two appetizers and a salad), it was not even worth the wait. We sent the food back and went elsewhere. The salad was wrong and the appetizers were nasty. I don't know what has happened to Zada Jane's, but it looks like there are more bad reviews on here than ever before. Hopefully it will change for the better, but I will certainly not be back to find out.

We went at lunch time, and there weren't too many people sitting inside, and not sure how many were on patio, but since it's not that big, it didn't seem especially crowded either.  Waitress was quick with menus and drink order - and THAT is where it STOPPED!  My husband order the Druther's Clucker sandwich, and I ordered the No-Da salad. Now, my salad comes with baked marinated tofu, but I asked to leave off the tofu and replace with ahi-tuna. Since my salad came with tofu, which is $3.25 if you add it to any other salad, I ASSUMED (my fault!) that I would only be charged the difference between what tofu cost as an add-on and what the ahi-tuna cost as an add-on - which is $5.50. WRONG - we ended up having to pay full $5.50 because manager gave lame excuse that it was "sushi-grade tuna!"   Now before we ever got our bill and saw the above mentioned charge - we were already irritated because the WAIT for our food to finally arrive was ridiculous!!!  After we got drinks, we waited for a full 35 mins before that mgr came by and said "I just checked on your order, your food will be out in "2 more minutes!"  Well, 10 mins after that - we STILL had not received our food and I even asked husband if he was ready to just leave when it finally showed up!  My salad wasn't bad, but since it ended being a $14.45 salad - it was nowhere worth that!   My husband said that his sandwich and sweet potato browns were terrible - the chicken was so overcooked, it was tough, dry and like jerky. Also, his said that the sweet potato browns were like left-over sweet potatoes that they tried to make something good out of, and totally failed. We did not have a good first-time experience at all - I can't understand why people seem to like this place.

Today I made my second attempt at Zada Janes. A few month ago a few of us went for brunch but after hearing the wait was over 45 minutes and observing every table without food and only drinks... we decided to leave.   Fast forward to today. We arrived around 10 am on a Saturday and didn't have to wait at all. Yay! I'll be honest... I had very low expectations after reading reviews and my first attempt. I was pleasantly surprised that our waitress was prompt and checked in with us frequently to make sure our drinks were full and food was up to par. The mimosas were the perfect ratio of champagne and orange juice. Big plus. I ordered a classic meal of scrambled eggs, turkey bacon, grits and toast and my friend had the Booker T. Highly recommend you try the grits (SO good) and the Booker T!  This is a very trendy restaurant with beautiful artwork and a fun, chill atmosphere. Parking isn't bad either... just grab a spot in the lot behind the building.  Also, it's a dog friendly place. There were tons of pups out on the patio and it looked like the restaurant may have provided them with water bowls. Love it.   Overall, highly recommend and like others have said... expect a wait (grab a cup of coffee or a mimosa- or two) or just go earlier and you shouldn't have an issue.

I don't think Charlotte has alot of strong options for brunch but Zada Jane's proved me wrong. I checked this place out yesterday for brunch and left with a full belly and happy thoughts. The inside is eclectic and funky with bright colors with knick knacks everywhere and artwork by local artists on the walls. It reminded me of a place I would find in San Francisco or another liberal city and that make me happy. Plus every song that came on was something found on my ipod so good music, bright colors and big brunch menu? Count me in.   I got the Booker T's East Side Hasher. The bottom layer was the sweet potatoes which had a hint of cinnamon, then the sausage (you can get piggy, turkey or soyage!!) topped with eggs, cheese and green onions. I just stared at this when they brought it to me because I wasn't sure on how to conquer this bad boy but I just started from the right and kept on going. The biscuit was fabu as well (not too dry yet not a grease bomb ala Bojangles) and they had a mixed berry jam and apple butter at the table in squirt bottles, which I found charming. I can't wait to go back here again and try one of their savory/sweet dishes for breakfast. I also loved their coffee, strong and they don't have matching coffee cups so you can get a funky cup from their collection or bring your own. I heard that you have to wait forever at this place and that parking can be a pain but I didn't experience that at all. Maybe it was because of the hour change? No clue. We were packed like sardines in there so if you're claustrophobic, this may not be the best option for you. When we left around noon, the outdoor area was packed, I can't wait to go back and play some corn hole while I wait!

I was excited to try Zada Janes after hearing how fantastic it is and all the positive reviews. Unfortunately, I disagree with all of them. The service was terrible to start with, and on of being terrible, when she finally showed up, the server was rude.   The food was mediocre at best; my omelet was mostly oil and my husbands had so much garlic he couldn't eat it. The only saving grace was when the server couldn't figure out how to charge us correctly and gave up, giving us a side for free. Maybe we caught them on an off day? I don't think we will be trying again.

This place is VERY hyped by the Plaza Midwooders and I sort of see it?  Decor: eclectic! spunky! colorful! There's so much to look at.   Wait staff: We had a STELLAR woman helping us out. Very animated, very honest, very attentive. When she checked in after receiving our food, she immediately remarked that my dish was missing something (I was none the wiser) and brought out two sauce options. That said, those I dined with (seasoned Zada Jane goers) said the staff can be hit or miss - so keep that in mind.   Food: Pretty mixed. What I had was not good - a falafel special. I got THREE falafel balls (barely anything) on top of a sparse "bed" of sprouts, with 6 wedges of pita to dip in an enormous cup of hummus. Waitress brought me tahini and a delicious lemon aioli for dipping. The dish was just too small and odd. It should be on a bed of lettuce, or within an actual pita if they want to make it a sandwich. Every other dish at the table looked delicious: a custom omelet (it was enormous!), the bunny rancheros, and the valid spinach salad. So I will be trying one of those next time!  Overall: Not thrilled, but I'm definitely going back to try out some different options.

My *last* experience was such a disappointment. Before that, my beau and I were very happy with our past dining experience and dishes, as well as the super cool ambiance. The past Sunday,on top of being sat next to the dirty wooden blinds that trapped two huge flies, my eggs had a blond hair in them - GRODY to the max! No more Zada Jane's for us!

Came here last Sunday for brunch and I thought it was so cute. There was a little bit of a wait because they closed their outdoor seating area due to weather. Was told that the bloody mary's were really good so I ordered that along with the basic breakfast with over-medium eggs, biscuit, country ham, and sweet potato hash. Everything was delish except for the sweet potatoes they were a bit soggy. I hadn't had a decent biscuit and country ham in a while (I live in Los Angeles but grew up in Northern VA) and it was great. Very cute and fun environment. I recommend for brunch!

Maybe 2.5 stars actually...Bottom line: as others posted, food is very good most of the time, portions are not big for what they ask u to pay, prices are high, and the wait staff...AHHH the wait staff. I think they suffer from what the "help" at Boris & Natachas suffer from: the too-cool-for-the-room aloofness that they try to sell as coolness. Its rare you see grumpier, more put-upon acting servers/help than you do there; if I want ill-acting servers I'll drive to the beach and go to Dicks Last Resort. If DISH started opening for breakfast I bet they'd draw a lot of folks from this place, as at DISH they serve similiar food and most of there folks are great.

I adore this place and come here often, and bring family and new comers here a lot. Trick is to come early as you can to avoid a wait and do not park across the street, the barber over there will tow your car, I've had it happen :( but hey there is a sign so it was my own fault! If you do have to wait it is worth it, the food here is awesome! Portions are great prices are fantastic, coffee is delish and you can have as many cups as you want while waiting. The wait staff are sweet and the bar tender is always quick with your bloody Mary :) If you have the chance to sit outside please try in the summer its worth it and you can play some shuffle board too :)

Very frustrating management. Had a larger party and was told a 20 minute wait and waited over a hour. Hostess was very rude to us and then tried to sit us at a table that wasn't even wiped down yet. The only good thing was that we got coffee while waiting. Unless you have all day, enjoy being hungry for much longer than expected, and like being treated rudely by employers than this is the place for you. We were treated like an inconvenience and I was told "I'm not trying to be an asshole but you'd be better off inside."  The only saving grace was our waitress who was very apologetic for the behavior of her peers and the food was good. But did not make up for the unpleasantness of the seating. Our party ended up being split and half of us had a great server named Courtney and then the other half were treated so poorly by a waiter who refused to split the checks.

My husband and I had an early Saturday evening dinner here and loved it! I ordered the free-range chicken thinking maybe I should order something else since we make that at home fairly regularly. It's served with mashed potatoes and green bean casserole. I was pleasantly surprised, and reminded that I need cooking lessons, when every bite demanded the full attention of my tastebuds- YUM! My husband enjoyed his shrimp and grits and we both want to return. We've heard about big crowds and long waits here but seeing as though we arrived early, we experienced none of that. I did notice it had begun to pick up by the time we were leaving though.   I was impressed that Zada Jane's is entirely non-smoking. Besides the obvious health benefits to all and kindness to children who might otherwise be subjected to second hand smoke, I think the quality of their food also deserves to be fully tasted.  Excellent area to spend a few hours and walk around before or after dining.

This is such a cute little breakfast cafe. Parking is minimal, but we always get there early on Sunday mornings (Yelp says they open at 9, but I think they actually opened at 8). There's lots of outside and inside seating. I have tried to order different things, but I can't be swayed from the breakfast salad. Something about the combination of crisp spring greens, warm and flavorful potatoes, the savory marinated tofu, and the tangy vinaigrette makes me come back every time. It's filling and flavorful without being too heavy. It gives me an energy boost, doesn't leave me feeling like I need a nap like so many brunch options. My husband loves the Booker T, which is heavier and more indulgent. And the biscuits and jams, mmmmmm. Great service, too!

While I was visiting my friend she suggested that we go here for breakfast. It was great. I had a burrito, home potatoes, eggs and the best pancake ever. Forget IHop, Waffle House and any other breakfast chain.   Support local.

I love this place.  I was going to complain that there is too much food in some of the dishes.  Then I realized I would be a complete idiot for complaining about it when I eat EVERY SINGLE MORSEL EVERY TIME. Stuffed to the GAWDZ & i'm still eating. This place ROCKS. Go prepared to eat a mess of food because those options are there. Go for it. Oh & try the Chai Latte with almond milk. ORGASMIC on a cool fall day.

I'm not sure why this place is always busy.  I got the regular breakfast and eggs over medium.  There was no seasoning, everything was bland, and the eggs were runny.  The waitress was often no where to be found and had no personality.  I also listened to the waitresses argue over which sections and tables they had.  I will not be going back.  This was the 2nd time I have been and it was no better than the first.  I will also add, it was close to $30 for extremely bad food.  I actually wished I had gone to a Waffle House was how bad the food tasted.

My wife and I had breakfast at Zada Jane's today after church.  We anticipated that we would have to wait, but were fortunate to get a couple of seats at the counter.  I had tha Amaretto French Toast.  It was delicious and it was accompanied with orange butter.  The combination was wonderful. Also, we had the pleasure of meeting with and being served by Roger.  He is a delightul person and takes good care of you.   Zada Janes offers a great value for themoney with their generous, but not outrageous portions and their moderate prices.

Best little spot for breakfast/brunch (or dinner!) in all of Charlotte. The place has a really cool vibe as others have noted and it's totally trendy. I frequent the place anytime I'm in Charlotte and no disappointment to report. Food is consistently good -- the blazing saddles omelette is my favorite. Overall it's totally worth stopping buy for some great food, friendly service and a nice atmosphere.

I was looking for someplace new and fun to take an out-of-town friend for breakfast.  After running a quick search on Yelp, Zada Jane's popped up and it sounded like just what I was looking for.   We went on a chilly morning around 11:00 on a Monday (the MLK Jr. holiday) and it was quite busy.  Thankfully, not busy enough that we couldn't get a table, as I've heard the lines can be horrendous on Sunday mornings.  We were told to sit anywhere.  We sat far away from the door that people kept opening and letting in very cold air.   We were impressed by the menu offerings.  They were different and unique, as well as offering vegetarian options.  My friend and I both went with Booker T's East Side Hasher, which consisted of eggs, sausage (regular, turkey, or soy), and cheese atop sweet potato hashbrowns, served with a crispy biscuit.  Not to get technical, but the "hashbrowns" were actually home fries (i.e., cubed fried potatoes vs. shredded).  They not only were made from sweet potatoes, but also tasted like they were coated in a sweet honey.  YUM.  The eggs and biscuits were delicious, too.  Good choice!   And I agree with other reviewers that the coffee was excellent...although I would have liked more.  The service there isn't the fastest, and we didn't see our server that often (hence, only one refill on coffee).  After we finished our meal, another 15-20 minutes was added onto our time waiting for the bill and then paying for it.  Time that another good cup of coffee would have helped pass.    I'm looking forward to going back, but will go when time is not of the essence.  Food = good.  Service = average.

I have dreams of Druther's Cluckers!! The best sandwich on the planet. The roasted potatoes are great but can be hit or miss, meaning dry. But the sandwich always overshadows the occasional dry potatoes. I like the quirky atmosphere and the wait staff. It's just a fun place to go in an awesome part of Charlotte.
Really extensive menu. Great atmosphere. Innovative dishes, was well worth the 30 min wait. Look at their menu on their website!

I have been here twice now, one experience was a two star, one was a 3.5 star experience.   First, I came for breakfast, ordered sweet potato hash browns, a biscuit and herb gravy. Everything was brought out save the biscuit, which would be out of the oven soon, I was told. The hash browns were really fried chunks of sweet potato, not quote the expected. By the time the biscuit came, the gravy was cold, and they offered to bring a new cup of gravy. By the time they did that, the biscuit was cold. Very unfortunate, since they were tasty enough.  Second time, I came for dinner. The entree prices were shockingly high, so I never got to try one. I went with a sandwich instead, which was affordable and good, but somewhat bland.   Several people have compared this place to the wonderful, multi-award winning Sunny Point Cafe in Asheville, NC. Yes, it tries to go for the same vibe and eclectic color scheme, has similar menu items and the same berry jam. But other than that, it does not compare one bit.

Yum! If you're like me and like anything sweet potato, you have to try Zada janes. Their sweet potato hash is delicious; they're a little sweet and go great with their breakfast menu. A breakfast menu that includes chorizo as an option for your omelets, might I add.   But not just great for breakfast, their lunch has never disappointed me. Their sandwich options can feed any mood and their breads are always fresh.  The atmosphere, including the patio seating (corn hole included) also makes for an even better Zada experience. While I love the food for a quick bite and the restaurant itself, every time I've been there the service has always been a little lacking. Nothing extreme but my waitress will occasionally disappear for the better part of my meal. That's something that could be addressed but it hasn't stopped me from going back!

Some friends were in from Atlanta and we stumbled on Zada Janes while looking for a brunch place. We didn't have to wait long and we were able to get a cup of coffee while we waited to sit down. The service was great and our waitress was extremely nice. I've read some reviews that service can be slow, but we didn't have any problems. The food was great (I had the pancakes and cheese grits- yum!) and I can wait to go back and try more of their food.

I found this place by searching for "Hipster Charlotte"  on a recent interview trip.  I had a Cheeseburger, some roasted potatoes and a beer for lunch.  I think that hand cut fries would have been better.  I liked the relaxed atmosphere and I will be back here, should I get the job!!

Stellar breakfast! This place knows how to differentiate. With a menu that is sure to please any hipsters pallet.  Zada Janes goes all in on the local scene - including local art and local product and proteins.  May i suggest the Booker T omelette with turkey sausage and cheddar. The sweetness of the sweet potato, the spiciness of the sausage, and the cheesey delciousness is the best way to start a Saturday morning.  There is typically a line, but enjoy a cup of coffee, sit outside and enjoy the morning.

This is one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. It's a unique artsy fartsy place off Central Avenue with a great selection of fresh organic food. I prefer the breakfast fare.  I agree with Kaitlin. This is a neighborhood hangout and most times you'll be waiting 5-20 minutes to be seated. Parking is also a hassle.

Liked this place. There was a wait but we were seated quickly. Service was a little slow for my liking but our server warned us that they are understaffed for the day, can't hold it against them. We both had omelettes and both had he same reaction - not really what we anticipated for an "omelette" as the toppings are basically on top of (slightly overdone) eggs instead of mixed in as I would expect. Coffee and potatoes were great. If we come back I'd try something other than an omelette but would definitely give the place another try. Cute atmosphere.

Zada Jane's is my favorite breakfast spot in Charlotte. I usually get the Zada Janer - two eggs cooked any way you like, a protein (i get soysage), a carb (grits - they are great), and either a biscuit or toast (I go with the biscuit). It seems boring, but it is fabulous and plenty filling. They have fun variations on the traditional breakfast, as well. The Bunny Rancheros is a spin on the breakfast burrito, complete with guacamole, and the Booker T's is eggs, cheese, hash browns, etc. all layered into one big dish.   The only downside to Zada Jane's is that on the weekends, there can be a bit of a wait. I usually try to get there before 11, however, if you get there after, it can get up to 45 minutes, especially on Sundays with the church crowd. When it is cool, it is nice to sit outside though, and they have shuffle board and cornhole courts outside, and you can pour yourself a cup of coffee while you wait. In my opinion, Zada Jane's is worth the 45 minute wait.
Very tastey, but a little pricey for dinner.  At least for my cheap budget.

I'd like to start this review off by saying that in no way was my bad experience a reflection of the server.   My boyfriend and I came here on Sunday 11/19/2017 at 1pm.  This was our first visit. I called earlier in the morning to ask if they used latex gloves (I am deathly allergic) the woman answering the phone said they only used nitrile and they can't use latex because she was allergic. I replied thank God! Which, I hope she understand i was thanking God they didn't use latex not for her allergy. It's hard for me to find local places that don't use latex. So i was excited to add Zada Jane's to my list...  We walked passed a busy patio (with two empty tables) and walked into the restaurant to be greeted by a woman who instructed us to sit anywhere we liked. She then grabbed menus and asked if we wanted to sit inside or out. We choose inside because we saw two two-top tables open right away. She walked us to one of the two tops (third from the window) which was dirty. Which doesn't bother me. I understand things get busy. She, paused and said let me clean it for you, turned around and noticed the booth behind her was clean and that we could sit there. This was the second booth from the kitchen. We took that one because we weren't picky and didn't want to make her clean off a table. We were greeted promptly by our server, I wish I would have gotten her name. She got us water and mimosas. We ordered after that, build your own omelette and a side of bacon. We waited about 40 minutes for our food which is understandable for a busy place. During our wait a young woman (slim, with short hair) with four dirty cups stacked in her hand stopped by our table and asked who sat us at this table. Confused, I looked at her said said a woman at the front. She asked if our name was on the list. Still confused because we weren't informed there was a list or a wait, i said no, when we walked in a lady told us to sit anywhere we liked. She asked me again who it was. I told her I had no idea. Which i didn't because  she wasn't our server or the woman behind the bar and I hadn't seen her since. The woman put the dirty cups on our table, spilling the water and then with an attitude stated "i need to know who because someone did that earlier and fucked up everything for us." Walked away and came back to clean up the water she spilled and apologized for spilling it. At this point me and my boyfriend realized they must have been on a long wait. I honestly hope this woman wasn't the manager because I couldn't imagine a Manager speaking to customers like that or placing blame on us for something that had to do with the staff. We personally felt like that was a conversation we didn't need to be included in. And more so we didn't appreciate being accused of skipping a line we had no knowledge of. Both me and my boyfriend are bartenders/servers and would have been more than happy to sit at the bar or wait for a table. But we decided not to make a fuss about it. Our server asked if we wanted another round of mimosas and I told her we would wait for our food. A gentleman stopped by and dropped off our omelettes and explained that the side of bacon I ordered was in the oven and would be out shortly. We got another round of drinks and informed our server that my boyfriends omelette was missing the tomatoes and mushrooms from his omelette. Which wasn't the end of the world--we just didn't want to be charged for it. After we finished our omelettes and drinks the bacon, EXTRA crispy and greasy came out. The gentleman from before dropped it and apologized for the wait. I choose not to eat it and asked for the check. We didn't tell the server that the bacon was near burnt because we honestly just wanted to leave. So we paid for the $3.10 bacon that we didn't eat or get with our meal. As a server I understand food being wrong, going out late, kitchen having an off day, being maybe short staffed, busy on a Sunday for brunch and anything that may come with a bad experience. By no way did we take this out on our server. She was great. And I have had plenty of bad experiences at restaurants but have never wrote a bad review. The events I've described didn't make me write this review. The woman who stopped by our table and confronted us about something we had no control of did. Not because she stopped by the table but because when my boyfriend walked out of the restaurant she rolled her eyes at him in disgust. In all honesty the unprofessionalism this young woman displayed was horrible. None of her problems were our fault. And the only reason i didn't walk back into restaurant and ask to speak to a manager was because I wasn't completely sure she wasn't a manager. The service was great. The food was good even with the missing items. I'm sure on another day the bacon will be great. But the woman who cussed while speaking to us and rolled her eyes as we left is the entire reason we won't patron this place again.

Great breakfast. Never had lunch or dinner. Has the character you expect of a Plaza Midwood joint. Great service without an attitude. Super patio for a nice day. Support locally owned businesses! It's good for the economy and encourages others to open and flourish so we can get something besides the big franchise steak houses in our banker town! Good stuff.

A few of my friends are regulars here so I was excited to finally give them a try. We arrived a little after 11am on a Friday morning. Apparently this place is always packed, but when we walked in the place was pretty empty. #win.   We were greeted immediately and got our drinks.I'd checked out the YELP reviews and checked out the menu so I knew what I wanted to get- Blazing Saddles omelet with home fries. I opted for egg whites and the salsa and sour cream on the side.   Cue the waiting music.....  We seriously waited and waited for our food. At one point, I asked our waitress if the order was even going to come out. She said she's check on it but we still waited.   FINALLY.....the food arrived. That goodness it was hot. I was hungry enough to eat my fist I couldn't bear the thought of having to send the whole thing back. The food was fine, nothing to brag about. I could have used a bit more chipotle seasoning on the chicken but otherwise it was just....fine.   If my friends want to go back here again, I'd go but I'm not adding it to my brunch rotation.   Oh...just a head's up....parking is a nightmare. You're welcome! :)
I love the vibe here and am never disappointed. Check them out for dinner. Lots of good home cooked type meals and its always fresh.

I love this place! The food, the vibe, the staff, the location, the patio, the art, music, 1/2 price bottles of wine on Thurs and Sun - All fab!  I have been to Zada Jane's MANY times.  This is my go to place.   The only thing that holds me back from giving it 5 stars is that often, even though the wait staff are fabulous humans & very friendly, service can be very slow..  If they could just step that up, this would be a 5 star place!

I heard a lot of good things about Zada Jane's, but it took over an hour to get our food.  Once I finally asked the waitress where the food was at, she hcame back and said it was the computers.  Which, from looking at other reviews, seems to be a common issue.  The order was resubmitted, and finally the food came out.  The food was not impressive and certainly not worth an hour and a half.   Once the bill was brought there was no apology or effort to make it right.    I definitely have no interest in coming back, and would recommend others steer clear.

This place was HORRIBLE! I didn't mind the wait because it was super busy and after eating my meal, I don't understand why it was so busy. First of all, the waiter was not helpful at all!! He said it was "too busy" to make a substitution to the order (really?) and he couldn't heat our syrup! My fiancée's French toast was dry and tasteless. I ordered the Bunny Rancheros since it seemed to be a popular item, WRONG CHOICE! Needless to say, I will never eat at this place again!

This place deserves no stars. I ordered a Sunday traditional and they served it with no goat cheese or as a matter of fact with nothing that was supposed to be on it. The plate was also half empty. The food literally looked like it was only supposed to fill half the plate. Additionally, the wait was literally an hour for this. It was the worst dining experience I have ever had. Also the Bloody Mary was disgusting. Highly disappointed. I suggest no one ever comes to this dump.

Great, great place for breakfast!   Zada Jane's has some of the best biscuits in Charlotte!  The jellys they serve with them are made locally in Asheville.  The omelets are super yummy and huge!  I get them with a side of the sweet potato hash- I had never seen these before.  Diced sweet pototoes with a sprinkling of sugar, cinnamon and honey. Yum!  I love that you can order breakfast at dinner.  They also have the most interesting calamari- it isn't fried or breaded and my husband says it some of the best he's ever had.  It is a bit pricey but the food is worth it.
Best breafast I've had in my life!!!! Get the Booker T eastside hasher!!!!! I stop in charlotte ever other week and is a must go to!!!!

Went here for brunch with my wife after hearing from multiple people how awesome this place is. We went on a Saturday around 12:30, and had to wait about 30 minutes for a table. This place isn't too large, and it gets crowded ... so go early if you don't feel like waiting.   Bunny Rancheros --- JUST DO IT. I recommend it with the chorizo sausage to make it flavorful and a little more 'caliente'. It comes out looking a hot mess ... but it's a pile of awesomeness. It's a huge portion too, so come hungry or ready to share.   Druther's Clucker --- May be my new favorite chicken sandwich. The foccacia bread was perfect way to hold all the delicious ingredients together. The sun-dried tomato mayo spread complimented the sandwich perfectly. For the side, you cannot go wrong with the sweet potato browns.

My favorite go to restaurant for a simple meal. My dad LOVES this place. The cakes are amazing and the champagne cake is our favorite. I love sitting at the bar for brunch. Easy, no wait and the staff are always super friendly. Overall the food is good. It's nothing that blows me away, but I know I will get a decent meal for a good price. And the atmosphere is perfect for the neighborhood.

This was the weirdest and by far the worst dining experience in over 1.5 years in Charlotte. Spoiler: spend 2 hours there for a sandwich, nachos and a coffee. First, my family comes in for lunch, the place is busy and there's a family in line before us, so we get ready to wait. In the first 10 minutes nobody even acknowledges our presence. Everybody's just standing around waiting, while 3 different waitresses pass by on multiple occasions. Then the people in front of us get seated. We wait another 10 minutes before the waitress says she'll clear off one of 3 available tables. Two reminders and another 10 minutes later we get seated. The table she cleared off for us has trash around it - straws, utensils, crumbled up dirty napkins on the floor. We wait 15 minutes for the waitress to come around and get our drink order, which doesn't come at all. Then another waitress comes to take the order again, because the previous waitress "just left". At this point we've just given up on having any decent service, and agreed that the food has to be outstanding to make up for it. Half of our drink order comes, which were waters, and the waitress forgot to bring a third water for our daughter. I also ordered a cappuccino, which I had to remind the staff members twice about. Another 20 minutes pass. A guy in a dirty t-shirt emerges out of the kitchen, holding our plates: he has guacamole on his hands, touching my husband's plate with nachos, so the outside of the plate is filthy. The nachos were soggy, but if you wait for over an hour for lunch, anything becomes edible. I ordered a gobbler sandwich with a side of roasted potatoes. The sandwich was nothing special, potatoes were cold. You can tell our food was just sitting there forever before it was brought to us. After two reminders I finally got my cappuccino. It was served in a cute mug, but tasted like diner coffee and had a greasy film on top of it, instead of delicious looking milk foam. We finished our meal, at that point the family that was seated before us has just received their food. A few people at the tables around us had delicious looking breakfast items, but after today's experience, there's no way in hell I'm coming back to try those. I was looking forward to trying this place out, and everything from service and food to cleanliness of the place has left me greatly disappointed.
Good breakfast spot.  Fresh food, coffee is really good. Parking is awful.

After hearing great things about this place - we wanted to see for ourselves. .  We headed over at 8:30 on a Saturday night and was surprised to see only a handful of people.  The menu was simple but offered just enough variety. We chose the "Zada janes favorite" nachos and the Mecklenburger with roasted potatoes.  Loved it all! Nachos were pilled high with lots of flavorful veggies and chicken.  The burger was tasty and potatoes were perfectly crispy on the outside.  Our bill was reasonable at under $25, service was good and the decor was entertaining.  We will return soon to try some of the other menu items that look good.    The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is a strange sour odor from the time we walked in. I have a sensitive nose but that was really strong! I hope that was something short term has it was very distracting from all the other positive!
It was a great place to catch up with an old friend and coach. The service was great the food was wonderful and it was a nice setting for long-time reunion overdue
Awesome food, mimosas, and service! The only thing that sucked was they can't serve mimosas til noon on Sunday's...but that's an NC law and not their fault. Love this place!

This place is nicely tucked into plaza midwood. Deff a staple here in this area a must try! For the coffee drinkers if tabitha is working ask for the tabs special. Saturday and Sunday brunches are a bit crowded but i think that say something. Anyways great during the week too! Love this Charlotte gem!
This is a great spot! I think the food is of great quality! My only issues was with their service experience. Wish it was consistent.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place more & more every time!!! BONUS: It looks like they listened to their customers & lowered the prices!!! So now it's AMAZING & very affordable  It probably seems like someone who works here wrote this but nope....I really love it that much!  I had their meatloaf & she got the smokey bacon shrimp pasta.....both were OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! Well done as usual guys

In short, decent food in an eclectic atmosphere with a nice patio is completely overshadowed by inexcusably bad service. Today, the food took approximately 30 minutes to come out. A little wait, but not terrible, and it was incorrect (my friend requested a substitution that wasn't there) but overall decent. While finishing our lunch, I politely requested the checks because my friend needed to get to work. Then we waited. And waited some more. I tried to flag down our waitress who avoided eye contact. I had to get up and walk across the restaurant and ask someone else for the check, which still took nearly 10 more minutes.   Add this to a laundry list of bad service experiences at this establishment in the last year, and I guarantee I won't be back.

I was in the neighborhood around lunch time the other day, and decided to stop in for a quick bite.  After checking out the menu, I decided that I was in the mood for breakfast food.  I was really torn between the "Booker T's East Side Hasher" and an omelet.  The Hasher won out.  The sweet potato hash-browns were covered by frittata style eggs made with my choice of protein -  I opted for turkey sausage.  This was covered by melted cheddar.  I decided to get a biscuit and it reminded me of the ones my grandmother used to make.  My server also brought apple butter and berry jam.    The food was good and portion sizes were quite large - I ate half & had enough to take home for another meal. Price was very reasonable at $8.95.  My server was very friendly and kept on top of things. Based on this visit, I would certainly go back.

Well they have a tofu scramble, which is nice to find in Charlotte.  It's pretty hearty, and the addition of peas is a nice touch.  The mushrooms were undercooked, but maybe southerners can't cook mushrooms as well as pennsylvanians (you know cause most mushrooms are grown there haha).  The roasted potatoes were delicious.  I left with a full stomach which doesn't always happen with tofu scrambles.

I wish I could give Zada Jane's more stars but it didn't blow me away.  I liked it but I had a little higher expectations I will definitely be back and check out their brunch though.  All start with all the good stuff first.  1/2 price veggies apps on Wednesdays = awesome and I did enjoy the zucchini & squash cakes 1/2 price bottles of wine - Thurs. & Sund Atmosphere I loved the way the restaurant was decorated and it was cozy Menu has a lot of variety = great place for veggie lovers Salad dressings made in house are kick-ass  Things they can work on Service was just ok not bad but not great Entrees very expensive

Hipsters in the ghetto, multitudes on Saturday/Sunday mornings seeking sunshine and a breakfast combo, fantastic apple butter, shuffleboard, Vegan/Veggie appeal, and a lack of parking for everyone to enjoy. Zada's is definitely a staple that deserves to be on everyone's breakfast shortlist. Find it odd that I've yet to write a review until now.   Here's the gist: If it's cold or raining, sit inside. If the wait is monstrous, I typically won't stick it out. If it's sunny outside, do yourself a favor and grab table on the patio. If the wait it horrifically long in general and you have to have your Bunny Rancheros fix, take a spot in line and play a few games of shuffleboard.   Pretty sure I get the Bunny Rancheros every time with wheat toast slathered with apple butter. The local chorizo isn't half bad either.   I'm a fan, it's great in a pinch, I like to pretend I'm good at shuffleboard, and I'd definitely take firstmeal at Zada's happen in a pinch. Winner.

ew. just straight ew. i'm sorry this place stinks. maybe it is the best Charlotte has to offer, but it is just gross in there.  no drinks for brunch, you have to have a drink menu if you are going to call yourself a brunch spot.  Also, fruit was blah and the hamburger was the nastiest thing i have ever eaten. fail

I went to check out the breakfast fare from reading the reviews on here.  Needless to say, I wasn't thrilled.  I ordered scrambled eggs, turkey bacon, herbed spuds and a pancake along w/orange juice and a coffee.  The eggs were okay, the turkey bacon tasted like a cheap store bought brand, it was very chewy and didn't have a good flavor at all, the herbed spuds tasted like they forgot them in the oven all morning.  They were very, very dry and shriveled up, not plump w/a good potatoey texture at all.  The pancake was great!  It was cooked just perfect, soft n fluffy with a perfect crispy edge all around! The coffee was great.  I expected the oj to be fresh, but to my dismay it was a carton brand.  Service was good and the waiter who I think is the owner from the reviews I read sat down in the booth right next to me to take my order, heck he was damn near sitting on my lap! Lol!  Unless I'm craving only pancakes n coffee I may be back, but I doubt it.

I've been hesitate to visit for brunch given the extremely long wait times.  However, when I was craving a salad for lunch this week, I headed to Zada Jane's for a bowl of greens.  I had the chopped salad - subbing mixed greens for the romaine and sunflower seeds for the croutons - with lemon vinaigrette.  The portion was perfect for lunch and filled me up without leaving me uncomfortable.  For vegetarians, this is a great restaurant.  There were three different protein packed and hearty salads sans meat.  The breakfast entrees also sounded very appealing and I'll be back for their biscuits and homemade apple butter.

Pretty good, but didn't live up to the hype.  I had the Blazing Saddles omelet, and the chipotle chicken in it was a little tough.  The roasted potatoes didn't have a lot of flavor.  A friend's blueberry pancake had like 6 blueberries in it.  I really enjoyed the jellies on the table though, and had two yummy (spicy!) bloody marys.  Service was okay...they brought out everyone's food except for one person's so we had to wait on that.  My water sat empty for a long time.  They weren't very busy.  Our server was very friendly, though.
Very cool, eclectic neighborhood restaurant reminiscent of Asheville, NC - great food and neat ambience, recommend the veggie nachos and hummus salad!

Went to Zada during a busy time. Had about a 40 min wait to get seated and after we placed our order had to wait about an hour before it even came out with no update on how long it would take. Food was very good but not sure if I would return again if it was busy. Not worth it to me

Went this past Sunday for breakfast with the hubby since I've heard great things about it. We did wait about 25 minutes but it was worth it! I had the basic breakfast with sweet potato hash browns, the most fantastical biscuit with their homemade jam, and I HAD to try the mixed fruit pancake... Hands down best pancake I ever ate! The hubby had bunny ranchero which was a mix of chorizo, black beans, sour cream and eggs, served with tortillas! He licked the plate clean! Would recommend this place especially if you are tired of the same old breakfast joints.. I want to go back this weekend!

Had an amazing meal tonight! Sat outside in February! Chef Don sent over some great Pimento Cheese appetizers for our group of 8. The wine was great and our dinner was amazing. 2 of us had prime rib which was perfect! Two others had the salmon which was delicious and very healthy! The other four had the country fried chicken. That was the hit of the night! It was like a "Party in the mouth" as one of our friends put it! It was a great way to end the weekend! Plus half price bottles of wine! Check this Plaza Mid Wood jewel out for yourself! You will not be disappointed!

Went here on a Sunday and it was pretty busy. It was hard to find the host since there is no host sign or stand. Put our name in and was told it would be 30-40 minutes. It was over an hour. I'm usually pretty understanding but when it's double the wait you were told and you see people who came in after you get seated that's pretty frustrating. We also could see on the list the host was holding names crossed off above and below our name. I give the place 3 stars for good food that came in large portions. For waiting an hour I'm expecting GREAT food, so 3 stars it is.

A friend and I stopped here on a trip to Charlotte on one of her coworkers recommendations. The exterior is cute and quirky with a big patio. The interior is taken up by a large kitchen space in the middle.   The service was friendly and we were seated quickly.  The menu was interesting. Nothing on the menu really appealed to me which was surprising. Either it was salads and sandwiches or $20 entrees. It was a strange mix. I ended up with a salad and a chicken and apple quesadilla. The quesadilla was really good. The salad was pretty standard but had a lot of stuff in it. And the salads are big.  My friend got a chicken sandwich and she didn't really care for the chicken. My friend ended up with food poisoning later that night and was sick all night long. I can't say it was from here, but this was the last place we ate.  At one point they ran out of unsweetened iced tea and the server was really apologetic and didn't charge me. I had already had two glasses and thought that was nice of her.   Overall, this place has potential but just missed the mark for me.

One of my girlfriends had not been to Zada Janes so we met there for dinner the other evening!  Decent wine selection but more of a casual dining experience with a "dinerish" feel than a place to have a bottle of wine with the girls.  We grazed on several apps and would definitely recommend.  The best part about the evening.....I left my keys there while we walked down to a different venue, I called when I realized I did not have them, they held them for me and we return to retrieve.  On the counter was a Champagne Pistachio cake with Cream Cheese Frosting staring us in the face.....of what did we say?  "one piece and 3 forks please...."  BEST homemade cake I have had in years.  At $7.00 a slice it was overpriced but hit the spot!

Great spot to have brunch. Plan to wait though because every time I've been, it's packed. The food is farm fresh and local which is a huge plus in my book! Everything I've tried has been delicious. I've never once been disappointed. The coffee is very yummy as well. Service is a bit slow but I'm assuming it's because they are always packed. So just be a bit patient. Definitely a unique menu, not food you will see at a typical breakfast place. All in all, love the food and the cute homey feel of the restaurant.

I love Zada Janes! My only complaint is that so many others love it just as much as I do which makes getting a table a hectic experience. Be prepared to wait if you come during normal breakfast- brunch hours. Outdoor tables can be wobbly but don't worry, your food won't be on them long!

Came here for dinner Friday night not expecting that much butI must say I was pleasantly surprised with the quality and taste of their food. I ordered the fish special of the day, which was monkfish, on top of this cheesy smashed potatoes and grilled asparagus... Absolutely amazing and flavorful.  My boyfriend had the pork chop which he loved as well. We also ordered the hummus and tzatziki trio with pita chips that was so yummy that we brought home an extra container. With its downtown artsy vibe reminiscent of the places I used to go in the East Village of NYC, along with great food and service, this place is a definite must.

Been here for 35 minutes with 3 different servers because me and my friend decided to move inside since the servers outside decided to pass us without greeting us. All the servers here look clueless and did not help us at all. The place isn't full and it's taking forever.

See here's the thing, I don't care how good the food may or may not be, if you can't park and you can't EVER get a table, WHO CARES?  As you might be able to tell I'm more than a bit perturbed by my latest encounter with Zada Jane's.  I went here an hour ago looking to grab a quick bite before getting ready for the Super Bowl later today.  This is now the fourth time I have been to Zada Jane's, and I have only been able to eat there once.  No jokes, No exaggeration.    As I was saying I went here on Sunday morning, arrived by 9:10am.  Took 5min to drive around desperately searching for a space.  After finally finding a tight spot, which may or may not have been a real space, my friend and I went in and were told the wait would be 10-15min, we waited 40min.  No one looked close to finishing their meals.   One party had left since we had been waiting.  We had no choice but to bail before we were committed to waiting another 45min to be seated and for our food to arrive.    Zada' Janes may very well have the best damn tasting breakfast in all of Charlotte - maybe their eggs are sent down from heavenly chickens laying only the freshest, locally grown, free range eggs in clouds instead of nests, and their pork cut from only the biggest, muddiest, hogs, I don't know.  But I do know, It's IMPOSSIBLE to get a table and eat a meal on the weekends in any sort of timely fashion at Zada Jane's.  If you look for long lines, and crowded restaurants as any indication of good food, then you'll think Zada Janes is the greatest food known to man.  I, on the other hand, like to eat a good meal, AND be able to get in and out in a timely fashion.  It'll be a long time before I go to Zada Jane' to eat...I mean WAIT.

Five stars for food (best huevos rancheros of my life) but three for service. Our service was very patchy and they forgot to put in orders for two people in my party, so we waited almost an hour before the mistake was realized. Chatting with some regulars at the bar, we were given to understand that that sort of mix-up isn't uncommon, but I guess the food is so good that everyone is willing to keep going back and roll the dice...

The outside seating is very sunny and hot but the indoor seating was smelly. However our waiter was friendly and cooperative with our seat changes. The food was predictable - nothing memorable m. The food was slow to come.

I stopped by Zada for the first time this week for a mid morning breakfast.  The service was fine, and the menu selection was diverse with some very interesting vegan and vegetarian options.  When I ordered my breakfast combo, the menu indicated I could pick one protein and one carb - and the carb I requested was the cup of fruit.  To my surprise, the waitress told me that there was an upcharge for this - really? an upcharge for a few pieces of melon, when my other options were potatoes, gritz, and a variety of other pretty unhealthy choices!    The food itself was just decent...my scrambled eggs weren't very warm and weren't overly exciting - the turkey bacon had a unique taste and was pretty good, but the biscuit I had seemed rather old, as it was really dried out.    Overall Zada had a nice feel to it, a very unique place with unique menu selections, but I left rather disappointed.

We went to Zada Jane's because it was just down the street from our Air BnB. While the atmosphere is inviting and the staff welcoming, the service was slow. After ordering our food, we were given our beverages and then checked on a handful of times. The bartender seemed to be working all of the jobs and wasn't very organized. We waited an hour for our food only to be told twice, "it's being plated and coming out in a few minutes." We ended up leaving money for our coffees and walking out. I'm sure the service is better during a slower time, but we were not impressed.
Love this place.  The food is great and the prices reasonable. A bit noisy inside, but at least it is lively.

going to get straight to the point...only reason for the 3 stars is because i am a BIG fan of zada's breakfast (pancakes, biscuits, french toast), but i'm not a big fan of the lunch options so i had to go with 3 stars instead of 4.     the atmosphere is very cute, fun, and chill.  i have breakfast work meetings there often and it's a great place for us to get together to have a tasty breakfast and discuss work topics without being in a stressful uptight setting like starbucks.  zada janes in much more relaxed and the cafe seems to have it's own lil personality.  biggest flaw is the parking situation....luckily i haven't been there on the weekends but even during the week it's a mess.    to sum it up, definitely a fun place to check out.  my opinion, go get breakfast one morning when it's not crazy hot and eat outside.  just be prepared for the parking situation and your experience should be a good one :)    enjoy!!
My wife and I looove this place. It is our go to restaurant on lazy afternoons. I like the chicken salad wrap, my wife gets grilled cheese. Good stuff.

Four stars on the following basis: dinner here is the worst, but brunch is amazing; and the staff can suck pretty hard, but if you do get a good server they are really good. It's kind of hit or miss, but when I'm there for brunch (I tried dinner twice before giving up) the pros usually balance out the cons.

The food is great, love the location but the wait on a Sunday mornings is pretty ridiculous. The wait is the sole reason Zada's didn't get 5 stars. Corn-hole makes the wait more tolerable & the food, decor and great service make up for it -just don't go for brunch on a weekend if you're starving or in a hurry!

We arrived around 9 am on Sunday. It was getting busy and the waitress was nice and friendly but took a while for our food to come (understandable and who is in a hurry on Sunday morning anyway)! I built my own omelette with chicken, bacon, basil, broccoli, and cheddar cheese. The coffee was fresh and delicious and the patio was a perfect place to sit.

Zada Jane's never lets me down! This is a Plaza Midwood gem. Breakfast served all day; local coffee from Dilworth coffee; and a great outdoor patio. The only downside is that the limited seating makes for long waits. I don't bother coming here on weekends.   My usual order is the Bunny Rancheros: potatoes, black beans, & chicken under Eggs. Served with queso, salsa verde, guac, sour cream, and warm tortillas. I promise it tastes better than it sounds! You have to just try it.   The servers are friendly and as attentive as they can be on busy days. The coffee (served in mismatched random coffee mugs) is always refilled before I hit the bottom of the mug...and that's all I ask for!

Props to the biscuit, jam, bocce court, gravy, friendly waitress.  No-go on the undercooked sweet potatoes, overcooked eggs, hostess, weak coffee.  Overall pleasant experience but food was just OK & the inability of the staff to figure out their seating arrangements, wait times was just unprofessional.  Don't mind waiting at all on a weekend morning, expecting that to happen.  Hearing statements like "we really need more chairs" and "it might be 20 minutes or 2 hours" just makes it seem like they're either not training hosts or don't care if you stay/go.    I did thoroughly enjoy my biscuit.
Today I came early so the service wasent as terrible as usual.  I am updating my review to 4 stars because the omelette I had was very good (cheddar cheese, green onions, and spinich).

I've been to Zada Janes more times than I can count.  When it first opened I was eager to give it a chance and they seemed eager to please.  It seems to me that Zada Jane's head has gotten a little big as of late.  The waitstaff is now so elite they could care less to actually serve their customers.  One time, the hostess made us sit outside when it was sprinkling.  She didn't even ask if we wanted to sit inside.  And we were the only people out there.  Our waitress moved us inside the first chance she had.     Over a year ago, I took my dog and ate outside.  The waitress brought me a cup of water for her without me asking.  Wow, have things changed.    This past weekend, a friend and I went for breakfast around 1pm.  We didn't have to wait because we ended up sitting at the bar.  After being seated, we weren't even acknowledged for over 10 minutes but the guy behind the counter was busy serving everyone around us.  When he finally took our drink orders, I was ready to place my order, but he didn't stick around long enough to ask.  It took another 10 minutes to get our drinks.  When we finally did order, he asked for our order and continued talking to other people (I wasn't even sure if he heard me).  After another 20 minutes, our food came out.  Redemption.  The food is delicious (and healthy).  I had the Blazing Saddles - it's an omelet with black beans and chicken topped with sour cream.    Run Down:  If your willing to put up with the snobby, elitist, slow waitstaff to get some delicious breakfast food and you have a couple hours to loaf around, this is a great place for breakfast.  I'm not saying the service is ALWAYS this bad, but I wouldn't risk it.  If you are hungry and you see people waiting to be seated, turn around and go to the Dish or Penguin.  Their service is always fast and friendly.  If you still want breakfast, try the Original Pancake House.

When we first got there we waited about 10 minutes for the hostess to even take down our name. The person in line in from of us left because he had been waiting so long. We had about a 30 min wait which isn't a big deal especially since it was Sunday afternoon. I ordered the tofu curry scramble which doesn't mention on the menu that it's covered in peas (which I don't like) then I noticed that lipstick was on my coffee cup and it wasn't mine as I wasn't wearing lipstick. I told my server Melissa about it and she said "oh that's unfortunate, I'll grab you a new one" no apology and still got charged for everything. I asked if I could not get charged for the coffee and she said well I only charged you for 2 instead of 3. Won't be returning to this place
Had an omelette.  Nothing fantastic, but good.  Service was hurried, but there was a mob waiting to eat.  Don't go when you are hungry on a Sunday morning - you might starve!

Friday night was chill. We walked up in the place, and there were like two couples inside and a table of 3 people outside. It was rather cold inside, so we went outside to take advantage of the brief sunny weather that decided to peak out during the midst of all this rainy weather. It was breezy and cool... perfect. There were at least 3 different people (I think) coming to our table. I LOVE people watching so the area definitely served that purpose.   I didn't get a chance to capture our appetizer through photo, but it was good and healthy. Pita bread with zuchinni/squash patties and tzaziki sauce. The sauce was decent... I felt it was missing something. I've been to some good Greek restaurants and I can taste the difference. The patties needed a little flavor.   I had the Huevos Rancheros and that was pretty good. It would have been better if they gave me like 3 or 4 tortillas; as it was A LOT of food and two just wasn't gettin' it. I think they folded them and put it on my plate for presentation. They could have just wrapped it up in some foil and put it on the side.   The 4 Layer Chocolate Cake was decadent. It was fresh, as I was told they order this from another bakery daily or every other day. Would have been nice to have a dollop of some vanilla ice cream on the side.   Other than that, the service was decent. It dwindled down a bit when others came. No refills to the water when we really needed it after the cake came (since there was no ice cream to wash it down with... yes... wash it down). Also, I don't think I'm going to have people box my food anymore. She came out with the cake and left me wondering where my food was. I think after it comes out, I like to keep it in my sight.   All in all, a decent joint.

We eat at Zeda Janes regularly - service is always slow (sometimes painfully) but the food is good, so if it's a Saturday morning and we don't have anywhere to be it can be worth it. We came in this morning when we had off work (thinking it would be a little quieter than a weekend) and sure enough we got sat right away. We put in our order and waited. And waited. And waited. And waited. For about an hour. Everyone who was sat after us had their food and finally the waitress came to tell us that there had been an error with the computer and our ticket was never put in. Not ideal- but mistakes happen so we continued waiting. And waiting. And waiting. At this point we'd been there for at least an hour and a half, and it had been 30 minutes since we were made aware of the mistake. We told the waitress we were going to head out and she asked if she could go check on the food to see if it was almost ready. 5 minutes later she came back and said it was about 3 tickets behind. When they realized they never put in our order they didn't even move it to the front of the line??? I can assure you that the food CANNOT overcome service that is THIS terrible.   There are plenty of brunch places in Charlotte with awesome food where they will actually treat you like a paying customer. Go to one of those.

We love Zada's! Jodie makes the best Mimosa and Bloody Mary and always has a smile on her face.  Great variety and selection of healthy, fresh, and local food whether you are a vegetarian or not. The bacon is amazing as is the French toast and their Huevos. Sometimes we just grab a biscuit to go which is also a great option.  Don't miss out on this spot! It does get crowded at high times but Jodie will make you a mimosa or there is free coffee while you wait!

Consistent, eclectic fare at reasonable prices.   Large portions.   I eat mostly breakfast at ZJ's, have tried most of the menu over the years, and keep going back.   I've even figured out when to arrive so I can park!

There are many things I like about Zada Jane's - in concept.  They're in my neighborhood, which means when I wake up craving brunch I don't have to drive across town.  They have a variety of vegetarian options (I'm not a vegetarian, but I'm not a heavy meat-eater either).  They use local sources for their food.  They have a funky and eclectic décor.  They have free coffee while you wait for a table.    Unfortunately, whenever I go there, the reality tends to play out like this: I wake up craving brunch, but when I get there the line out the door.  It's so chaotic inside that it takes me ten minutes to find someone to put my name on the list.  I fight my way through the throng to get some coffee only to discover there aren't any coffee cups.  Then I wait so long for a table that by the time I sit down I could have driven across town, eaten somewhere else and gotten back home again.  And that's not even counting how long it takes for my food to come out.  When my food finally does arrive, every other time it's overcooked or undercooked, or it tastes like someone spilled a whole salt shaker in my hash browns.  But I eat it anyway, because there is no way I'm sending anything back and waiting for it to be cooked again.  And then I wait....and wait...AND WAIT for my server to remember I'm there and bring me my check.  By the time I leave I've lost three hours, and I'm not even fat and happy.  (Just fat.)  There's no denying this is a popular place, but sometimes I wonder if other people are having a different experience from mine, or if they've decided they love it so they put up with the slow service and the inconsistencies with the quality of the food.    Whatever the case may be, my husband and I have decided not to waste our time on Zada Jane's anymore.  We've had too many broken-hearted brunches to let ourselves be hurt again.  We've found a new brunch spot - Foskoskies on Shamrock.  We have yet to be disappointed there.

This restaurant used to be unique. We had lunch on 1/16/15. Food took 45 min. To be delivered & was not edible. Plus our credit card was charged twice. Will not recommend or go back. Too many other great restaurants in area. Good luck!

Due to the crazy lines on the weekend, I now only visit Zada Janes on off-hours (I realize this is becoming a theme in all my reviews--i.e., I hate going to places when they are busy. So be it).  When I do visit, I am particularly fond of Z-J's East-West breakfast--which is a tofu curry scramble that doesn't leave you with that gross I-ate-way-too-much-at-brunch feeling.  They also have more decadent offerings, such as their vanilla french toast and very delicious (if not artery-clogging) sweet potato egg hash.    If you ever have a chance, it is particularly nice to stop by during a weekday for brunch (a rare but lovely occurrence for me when it does happen), and I'm hopeful it will be a good place for me to grab a bite with my bambino when that time comes.    Also, they seem to have great hours and appear to be open throughout the day, for which I give them many many high fives.  Service has always been excellent here, too.

I have always heard about this place and people have been recommending it to me since about 2014. I was always unsure of what they served and hesitant when seeing the place, but I must say it definitely proved me wrong. We came here for brunch after drooling over the pics of dishes online. We were sold with the steal they had on bottles of champagnes for mimosas. It was more than enough and could barely finish the bottle between the two of us. As far as food, I ordered the Belvedere with sweet potato mash, and a side caesar salad. The omelette was amazing! The sweet potato mash? Not so much kind of just left that alone. The Caesar salad was great after I picked all the sun dried tomatoes out because they were a bit overwhelming. Nonetheless, as crazy as it sounds I was still very much so satisfied with my meal and experience. We had great service from the bartender Tab. She kept us laughing and was on point with everything we needed. I see why this place is highly recommended and I can't wait to return to make use of their outdoor area.

I have visited Zada many times when I lived close to the neighborhood.  The breakfast was always spot on especially the Bunny Rancheros which was great even as a to go order.  Honestly one of the best breakfast dishes in Charlotte.   I moved away a few years ago and I convinced my spouse, who has never been, that the waking up early and drive to Zada to beat the crowd would be worth the effort.  We got there at the crack of open for our visit because there were many other days we drove by and he said, "it's too crowded".  We were one of the first seated so I'm glad.  We were ignored. Embarrassingly a while ignored.  Enough where we got to witness a couple sat well after us arguing about why this place was a "hot spot".  Thankfully we were finally approached and gave both drink and food order because we weren't sure if we would have another opportunity. I ordered the special that I swear was pork belly on biscuits and my husband ordered the Bunny Rancheros because I have talked about it for years.  18 minutes later my husband got his food and we got our drinks. We started eating his breakfast because, well damn, we were hungry.   Our server finally came back and I was told,"sorry, we don't have biscuits. would you like something else?".  Honestly?  Erase it from your special board before you open.  As we were still sitting we heard an employee possible manager say the biscuits were burned throw them out and fire another. Then our server came out and asked after we ate the Rancheros if I would still like my biscuit pork belly order.   I understand bad days.  I understand burnt biscuits.  I loved Zada so much I convinced someone who had never been to get there the moment they opened.   It was honestly the most awkward introduction to a restaurant recommendation and one of the most memorable never coming back experiences ever.

Wanted to take my out-of-town guests here for breakfast. One guest has dietary concerns and she wanted to see a menu before we went. Their website says they serve breakfast all day but the breakfast menu is nowhere to be found.   We thought if we could get a few answers about the food it would clarify if my guest could eat there but no one answers the phone even when its not peak business.  Guess they don't need ours.

Very fun, eclectic feel. The atmosphere seems like a place where creativity would thrive.   We had a special dip with mint and feta cheese with pita bread, which was delicious! The Green Mindmelt Panini was very good as well.   The service was friendly. We didn't feel rushed so we were able to enjoy the evening, no pressure.  Zada Jane's is a quirky cafe which gives the impression that it is a casual and moderately priced place; however, they have some high priced entrees on the menu.
