The fancy entrees feel misplaced here. I think that if I want to spend a lot on a steak, I would go elsewhere for the environment.

Wow I can't believe I never wrote a review of awesome Zada Janes!  I hate vegetables! My girl is the opposite. She is in fact a vegetarian. This is why zada janes has one of the best things in Charlotte for me. They offer one of the ultimate in meatatarian breakfast dishes in the Vegless Avenger.  Picture a giant fluffy egg filled with bacon, sausage, chicken, chorizo, and everything meatalicious. This is the best hangover cure and source of protein ever, though probably not the healthiest.  My girl on the other hand loves the nachos and the bunny rancheros.  The coffee is great and so is that jack and coke in the morning.  This is my favorite breakfast spot in plaza midowood.  I have never have tried the night menu, but this is definitely a awesome spot for lunch/brunch.  Also, there is shuffleboard to get your geezer on.

Zada Janes is wonderful. It quickly became my favorite brunch spot in Charlotte. The variety of people (and dogs) outside makes Zada Janes feel so welcoming and sunny.   I love their blend of southern classics (grits, biscuits) with southwestern options and vegan and vegetarian options. And best of all, they support local vendors when they can. Zada Janes has something for everyone.   When I sat outside with my dog, a waiter came up to ask if he needed water and brought over a bucket. I'm just as happy inside, where the purple walls and funky art make me feel at home.   Fair warning: Service can be a little slow when they're packed, but go early or late and you shouldn't have an issue.

Finally got a chance to visit this iconic breakfast place (that also serves lunch), in the awesome Plaza Midwood area.   Short version: I went for breakfast/brunch and I enjoyed everything I had. The service was great. Parking in the lot is very limited but parallel parking on the street is also available (I was there on a weekday around 11:30am). Definitely try it especially if you have been to eateries in Asheville and like that vibe.  Long version: Had a brunch with some peeps we ordered a Breakfast Salad, Booker T's Sweet Potato Hash and Belvedere Omelet (I'm actually missing one dish because I can't remember what it was) and a side of Gluten Free pancake.  Everything was delicious. Everyone loved their food. The Gluten Free pancake was the best GF pancake I had ever had that wasn't made at home. I also ordered an orange juice because it's one of the few places that actually has fresh squeezed.  One of the members in my party was celebrating a birthday and they were kind enough to bring out a slice of Red Velvet cake for her.   Overall, it was a great experience and would like to return. I don't know how they fair on weekends but they don't have a huge amount of seating indoors but do have a patio area with fire pits and that section is pet friendly. There is free parking on the side streets and their lot offers rooms for about 8-10 cars so get there early!
Service is outstanding. Food is fresh and delicious. The variety is impressive. We have been here 4-5 times and have loved each visit!

Breakfast is one of those meals that seems to dirty all the pots, pans and dishes. This past weekend, I just wasn't feeling that so I ran through the nearby spots in my head and picked Zada Jane's Corner Cafe for my next meal. My husband and I arrived at 9 so the first wave of diners had already breezed through. We opted for cappuccino and a hot tea. I was impressed with how hot my coffee stayed. Our server gave my husband an extra hot water half way through the meal to get another cup out of that loose leaf tea. Nice! Its cold next to those brick walls on a chilly day so that was much appreciated.  I opted to piece a breakfast together which I normally do. Got two eggs over easy, bacon and a biscuit with herb gravy. I looove that gravy. It's loaded with thyme. Mmmm. Bacon more crisp than I make it for myself but who cares when the rest is so satisfying?  We had great service and left nice and full!  Cozy up to the sit at counter if there is a wait.
The only knock on this place is the lack of seating availability while you wait.  I took my father here for brunch and we both enjoyed the omelette over the sweet potato hash.

When a place is so popular they don't need to give a shit about customers to get business.. they still should.  That's just business ethics.   I'll spare you the details of my experience.  suffice to say, very rude.

This place was really cool. The decorations and artwork were neat. I had eggs with their roasted sweet potatoes which have been my favorite breakfast food in Charlotte. My husband got their grits and are definitely the best grits I've ever tried. Would come back again.

I was pretty pumped to go to this place for breakfast- I love breakfast food! I had the pancakes and the sweet potato Browns which were both delicious. The only critique I could give was that they were a little slow, although it was very busy and they had said they were down a person. It was a beautiful day outside so sitting out on the patio was also very nice.

I love to pop in and grab a coffee here. Last night I wanted to try a sit down meal. The meal read great, it was hard to decide on one item. I went for a splurge with the Breakfast burger which I order medium rare. My date also got the Meatloaf burger. The food took quite a long time to come out. We were the only guest in the restaurant which seemed like an open invitation for our server to invite herself to never leave out table. It was a bit annoying to be unable to speak to the person I can with 90% of the meal. She was kind and I don't think she knew what she was doing but you have to take social clues as a server. Finally she went and got our food and my burger was beyond well done. Super dry and just completed over cooked. My boyfriend was supposed to have a slice of meatloaf on her burger but it was just a normal burger patty. The only true positive is the Chai Latte and the Jalapeño bacon Mac side item. It isn't worth the price in my opinion. I have a hard time giving this place the 2 stars I think it really deserves because I truly love coming here for coffee.

If it had not been my last experience at my neighborhood Zada Janes that review would have had an additional star.  I adore this local gem and can forgive its short comings so-so service and all. My favorite is the bunny rancheros from the breakfast served all day menu. What a heaping of fresh food. However, I visiting Zada Janes last Sunday with a Groupon. I have never been hassled more for using a Groupon- even at sustainably more expensive establishments. For you see, a business chooses to send out a Groupon with the hope of attracting new or repeat customers. Since it was Sunday we enjoyed a bottle of half priced wine and then were told that since we had participated in this "deal" that we wouldn't be able to use our Groupon. Well- our Groupon did not apply to alcohol purchased so there would not have not been any additional discounts on that "sale" purchase. Instead of handling this with a smile we were lectured for several minutes about how we should have known better. I was so dismayed and as I explained- we live in the neighborhood- really enjoy eating here and will be back without a Groupon next time we come. Still- the lecture continued about combining discounts- on a Groupon that had none of this fine print. This last experience at Zada Janes really undid the delicious taste of my steak pita wrap and creme brulee  and apple cake desserts we ordered.  Yes- we did tip on the full undiscounted amount of the check. I'm all for supporting local business but this was a very negative experience on what I hoped would have been a relaxing Sunday evening night out.
Pumpkin pancakes are in season!
Service wasn't great but the food more than made up for it! Great local ingredients and perfectly paired dishes. Huge portions as well. Definitely a go to for hangover breakfast!!

I absolutely LOVE the food at Zada Jane's.  It is my daughter's favorite restaurant.  However, the service is absolutely dreadful.  Slow Slow slow no matter how busy or not busy.  Slow to seat us, slow with drinks, slow with the meal, it is really amazing.  Obviously impatient wait staff would rather chat with each other or customer's at the counter than serve the tables.  Amazing that Zada Jane's hasn't addressed their service problem.    We only go there when we have loooooooooootttttttttttttssssssssssss of time and aren't too hungry.  There are some great restaurants in the neigborhood that are getting our business simply because of the service issues.

This is the type of place where you can go and be content with life.  I went for their widely raved about Sunday brunch and I must say that it did not disappoint the service was friendly and the you could tell that it was a real community hotspot as most people simply walked from the near by neighborhood.   I absolutely hate coffee and all that it stands for, but when the waitress suggested that I should still try because it was that amazing, I decide to just give a try. I am glad I did.  At the time i went the coffee was local roasted by Dilworth Coffee and had a distinct flavor I had yet to taste  in this city. Maybe it was the french or maybe it was my imagination but it was AMAZING!  The food portions were adequate and tasted delicious. I got and omelet and sweet potato hash that were out of this world great.  Also big ups for the Gluten Free menu with awesome flavor.  If your ever in the mood for day of good conversation and inviting community try Zada Jane's it won't disappoint.
Awesome food, came for breakfast and it was great. Sausage and spuds were excellent. Biscuits and pancakes were also nicely done.

After looking at other pictures, I'm wondering if I even ate at the same place as everyone else. We went on July 4th (which we were prepared for a wait since a lot of places were closed). There were several empty tables, but we were told the wait would be 30 mins...ok, not so bad, as we were being seated we were told the kitchen was backed up and would take 45 mins to get our food. We were seated after about 20 mins and our waitress was just very...odd. Not rude, but also just kind of annoyed that we were ready to order (we didn't want to waste our whole day sitting around so we ordered drinks and food together when she came around the first time.   My husband ordered pancakes and they were fine. I ordered bunny rancheros with bacon...it showed up as a hot mess and nothing like the other pictures I saw on yelp. Even though my side was bacon, they crumbled it up and it was all over the plate, under eggs, under potatoes, etc. I'm not sure why I wasn't given a couple slices of bacon on the side. It was all ok, but not worth the wait.

ah, zada jane's.  i have actually heard one of the servers say, "we are not really known for our service," before.  i don't honestly think there service is bad, it is just the wait.  on a mild sunday last year, they didn't have the patio seating available.  i had the novel idea to go ahead and get our food to go rather than wait the quoted 45-60 minutes for a table indoors.  we sat outside and enjoyed our brunch in half that time.  i felt like i came up with a rounder wheel that day.  this time around, my dining partner and i put our name in and walked casually down to nova's for a croissant to tide us over while we waited.  in the most surrealist of experiences, they called our name not two minutes after we walked back through the door.  we were seated, served, ate, and had check paid all within a half hour.  i am PRETTY sure we were at zada jane's but i am not sure with it being such a whirlwind of convenience.  the food is actually worth the wait on slower days.  the grateful growers meats, the meat alternatives, the locally grown foods all just taste a little more pure.  the sausage has a good spice to it.  the turkey bacon is really quite savory.  the happy eggs are always satisfactory.  the french toast is to die for.  its just the wait.  and honestly, if you think about it, they do a fantastic job orchestrating the ridiculousness that is a plaza midwood brunch scene.  with the slews of families, hungover couples, straight from church groups, and friends just catching up, the place is always slammed.  all those people must think it is worth the wait as well...

Came here for breakfast with a friend and we sat out on the patio. I loved the patio it was a great atmosphere for a meal.  Our server was super friendly and helped me out when I was looking to get a half caff latte but they had to improvise as they were out of some ingredients. The coffee was perfect when I got it.  I got the kind of catch all breakfast, two fried eggs, black beans, grits and toast.  The eggs were cooked way more than I had wanted but were decent. The grits were totally flavorless. The black beans were my favorite, they were good.  Overall I found the breakfast to be very bland but would be interested in trying something else on the menu. I saw some people eating hash type breakfasts that looked delicious.

I thought I was hallucinating again but there it was: A quaint, trendy corner diner chock full of vegetarian delightfulness. The one drawback I had was that it took a literal eternity to get our food, but once it arrived it was like a choir of magical angels were singing a happy hummus song. I had ordered the Hummus salad and it was far more than I had bargained for. A massive plate hit my table with a scrumptious salad on the left side, hummus and couscous in separate ramekins sat in the center, while an array of toasted pita bread fanned out the right side of the plate. Couldn't even get through a third of it before feeling like I was going to explode. The prices weren't too bad here either. If the wait time wasn't quite as long, it'd be my lunch break pit stop every day at work.

Cute spot for brunch! We sat outside and it was a lovely atmosphere with great service. The bacon omelette was incredible and so are their potatoes. My boyfriend got the biscuit with gravy and an egg and loved it. Iced coffee was really good too. Unfortunately, they do not have gluten free bread but do have gluten free pancakes. Wait was not too long on Saturday afternoon! Would highly recommend.

My experience at Zada Jane's today is worth writing about.   I went to Zada's with the intention of grabbing a bit, sitting outside and getting some work done. A party of three was walking into the restaurant as I got out of my car. When I got inside, I saw that they had been waiting for a minute or two so I decided to use the restroom. After coming out, I saw the party leave. I waited around for a few more minutes before grabbing a menu and heading to a table outside.   About 25-30 minutes passed before another table was seated outside, and a server appeared to take their drink order. I looked up in an attempt to grab the server's attention, but she went a roundabout way to get back inside without passing my table despite the fact that it was right next to the other party. I dismissed the incident and assumed she was busy. This happened yet again the next time she came outside so I finally got up and left. I was at Zada's for over 45 minutes without ever being acknowledged.   To say the service was poor is an understatement. There was no service.

Let me start by saying I used to LOVE this place. The food is SO good and the gluten free and vegan options are great! But I think I will stick to getting take out from now on. Not only is the service terrible but the staff is SO rude. I feel like it gets worse and worse every time. I get it's busy but that isn't an excuse to be outright rude to paying customers.

We have been here multiple times before and had an awesome experience. The bunny rancheros, duthers clucker and veggies nachos are a winner every time! We talked very highly of Zada to our friends and decided to take them there for brunch two Sunday's ago. Ugh not a good idea.   Zada must of had an off day, because my friend ordered a mushroom Swiss spinach bacon omelet and the server didn't tell us they were out of spinach and mushrooms till she brought the food out. Um hello?! Since the omelet didn't have veggies she essentially got a half pig in her omelet. We had the remake the Omelet and go lighter on the bacon which took 15 minutes. Meantime everyone else sat while their food got cold and my chicken sandwich was over cooked which was disappointing. Anyways, when the check came the server said she removed the cost of the spinach and that's all. Well I hope you would.......  We always have had a good experience here, but it was embarrassing brining friends and it being bad, but don't worry I'll be back!!!   Recommendation: don't wait till 1:30/2 to go to brunch ;)

This is a great establishment. After looking for a little Asheville style restaurant we finally found Zada Jane's. We have come here a few times during the week and have always been happy with everything.

The food is pretty delicious and unique and the location is quite charming, and the prices are reasonable. So why am I being stingy with my stars? Well the service here is really quite horrible. Maybe I caught our waitress on a bad day or something but she couldn't possibly have been more rude or nasty.  It all begins when we walked into the place and no one decides to talk to us for about 10 minutes until I walk up to the counter and am told I can just sit anywhere. Okay understandable, I wish you had told me that earlier when I had walked in. Anyways I ask if we can move the tables around outside and the girl at the bar says sure thing. While sitting there waiting for the rest of the party to arrive, our waitress comes up and asks if we're sure they're coming. I feel like this was kind of a veiled attempt to ask if me if the rest of the party ditched us, and am tempted to give a sarcastic response but instead ask for a glass of water. She never brings any water. So finally everyone's arrived and the drink orders are taken before she brings any water around. I'm pretty excited about the food because it was a pretty delicious sounding menu. It takes a really long time for our food to come out even though there's only one other table of four there with us, but that's okay because we're having fun chatting and discussing the rest of the night out. Well the food finally comes out and I ask her if she could take a picture of us. She's like well how about I make sure everyone's happy with their stuff before I get around to you okay? Well excuse me! I wasn't aware that taking 10 seconds out of her busy schedule of ignoring my empty water glass to take a picture was going to bother her that much. And yes I did ask for my water glass to be filled but she never did get around to it, and disappeared off somewhere until it came time for the check.  I almost didn't tip her but I convinced myself to anyways since I still managed to have a good time despite all that. I don't think I'll ever be back unless I get dragged back though. I love the food and the atmosphere, but I like my food without a side of bad attitude, and I don't enjoy getting ignored either. I can think of places just as good that treat me with respect.

First time, so perhaps approached this place with unbiased eyes as someone from out of town, but I was not impressed. Server was surly. The "signature" plate of Bunny Rancheros was terrible. The potatoes were greasy and mushy, the black beans dumped out of a can, the chipotle chicken was dry and overcooked and the over easy eggs were undercooked. It was truly a flavorless and visually unappealing mess.  My friend added a pancake to his meal and it was rubbery.   Décor may have been cute 10 years ago but the place looks tired and the food certainly doesn't make up for it.  Given the amazing number of other breakfast and brunch spots, I was amazed that there was a wait for tables. I can't say I'll be heading back - there are so many other great breakfast spots around CLT!

This place seemed pretty normal.  WE went at 11:15 on a Saturday and didn't have to wait.  The service was fine but not impressive.  They don't allow substitutions and i HATE that.  The omelet I had with goat cheese was quite yummy and the biscuits weren't bad.  If you are into that whole organic/natural thing then this is def the place for you.  I  have heard the coffee is good but I can't say from experience.

The food was okay, but it took a LONG time to come, and my sandwich was cold, so in the end, it was just an okay lunch. I might come back for the outside patio, but there's not much else to recommend Zada Jane's.

I was really looking forward to brunch at Zada Jane's on a Thursday about 10am after hearing from great things from locals. However, after poor service, incredibly slow responses in every department and very lack luster food, I couldn't see myself ever returning.  My visit was mid-morning on a Thursday and the disorganization started when my group of six walked in. Do you wait for a table or seat yourself? I'd recommend at least checking in before sitting, especially if you want to sit on the patio. I placed an order for a TLC biscuit with a fried, runny egg, cheddar cheese and apple maple bacon. I was wit a party of six people and we waited 45 minutes for our food. During this time our waiter never checked on us, let us know when our food would be out or apologized/explained the long wait. When the food finally did arrive, it was not delivered together, there was a fifteen minute gap between meals arriving, with my simple biscuit arriving last. Two of our orders were incorrect, including mine where the fried egg was completed cooked through with a broken yoke and cheese was missing from my meal. After having them re-do my meal they biscuit arrived back with one tiny slice of bacon, way too much cheese and the actual biscuit was very sub-par. I would have blown it off as a simple kitchen mistake, but everything about Zada Jane's screamed "problem": from the food, to the slow service and waits to the waiter himself.  As a regular restaurant patron, I am paying for a meal and an experience that I cannot replicate at home. I would highly discourage anyone thinking of visiting Zada Jane's to save yourself from a disappointing experience.

I love going here for brunch or an early breakfast.  Convenient to home and I love how they offer you free coffee if there is a wait.  great place to chill and relax after a long night.  I never feel rushed here and I always order something different and have yet to be disappointed!

My wife and I stopped in for breakfast on New Years Day. The basic breakfast potatoes were delicious and seasoned perfectly. My wife's French toast with the apple butter and grits was "amazing".  The atmosphere was upbeat and social. Overall we had a wonderful experience.

Literally the WORST experience I have had going out in Charlotte.  The food came out SO slowly. It was just breakfast, but it took as long as a fine dining dinner to come to the table.  I had ordered a simple breakfast sandwich with bacon on it..... it featured ONE slice of bacon. Bojangles and Dunkin Donuts makes a abetter breakfast sandwich.  My wife ordered a more substantial meal, and hers came out burnt badly and look disgusting on the plate.  It takes a pretty awful meal for my wife to leave a meal mostly untouched.... and this was that AWFUL meal.  Between being slow, cheap and gross..... I feel comfortable saying that there is no worse place to get a breakfast in Charlotte.

There is nothing more frustrating then waiting and waiting for a table first thing in the morning, especially after a night that was heavy on the Patron.  However I'll wait all day at Zada Jane's downing some of the best coffee I've had in the area. Typical wait can be around 15-30 minutes for a Saturday or Sunday brunch.  Once you do get seated order biscuits while you go through the menu because everything is good and you may go through a serious debate on what to order.  If I can be of any assistance I'll just say that you cant go wrong with the Amaretto French Toast or the Bunny Rancheros.

Breakfast at zada janes is great but I am particularly fond of their dinner. The steak my fiancé has gotten and the chicken I have gotten are always delicious. The sides are great and it's always fresh! I suggest it for dinner for sure!

I was super excited to check out Zada Janes but not so super excited after waiting 45 minutes for my food!  That's right - 45 minutes.  So first things first, Zada is a very cute place.  The outside patio is located on a corner so you can eat and people watch all at the same time!  The menu has very unique options.  I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich with sundried tomatoes, caramelized onions and mozzarella cheese served on foccacia bread and my side was the black eye pea salad.  The food was quite delicious!  That is, when we finally got it.    Here is the scoop on the service.  We walked in and then immediately following us 2 other groups of people walk in.  The waitress takes their order first even though we had arrived earlier!  No biggie, I thought.  Well...I was wrong.  After waiting 25 minutes all the other tables had their food.  I waited another 10 minutes.  I finally got so heated that I walked in to find the server and politely told her that we had been waiting nearly 40 minutes for our food and that people who arrived after us had their meal.  Her response was "Sorry about that. We have a small kitchen.  I'll see what I can do about it."  We got our food about 7-8 minutes afterward.  In addition to having a long wait, my glass stood empty for long periods of time.  I could tell by the looks on other people's faces that they were in similar boats!    Given the circumstances, and my complaint, I thought maybe they would comp one of our meals or even my friend's drink.  Maybe offer a free dessert?  Just something  to say - hey, I know you didn't have the best experience tonight.  Well, we got nothing! With that being said, I'm not headed back anytime soon.  Not to mention, after reading other reviews, I'm not alone in my terrible service experience!

Amazing food! Awesome place... Great service... Kids and dogs welcome. Eat out on the patio on a beautiful day. I had a latte and the Bunny Rancheros... So good. Play shuffleboard on the sidewalk while your waiting on your meal or afterwards.   If I'm in Charlotte again, I will definitely be back.

Let's start off with the breakfast food being good. This review is geared towards their service. Our server Rachel was absolutely terrible. Firstly, she never even introduced herself. I only know her name because I had to ask another server. Then, they forgot one of our cocktail for our table and only when she came to take our order said "oh they didn't bring it? Huh... Well what do you want to eat?"  Being vegetarian, I asked if I could swap the chicken on my dish for guacamole (which is cheaper than chicken on their menu) to which she dismissively said "no" without even asking or trying to accommodate. She actually never came back (someone else brought our food) and no one ever came back to check on us (no refills, nothing) we had to flag down a totally different server after 15 minutes of finishing our food to ask for our check (Alexandra, who to be fair, was quite pleasant)  It was our first time but will certainly be our last.

Slowest service you will EVER experience when they are busy. Food is cool, but you may have to wait.   That said, I have their number saved in my phone and visit EVERY TIME I come to Charlotte. Yummy!!!

I'll just get this out of the way and say the service wasn't great, which is why it's only four stars, but everything else WAS great.  This was my first time to Zada Jane's because the patio is always packed, so I assumed there was a long wait. Our party of hour only waited about 20 minutes though.   I got the Bunny Rancheros with the Chipotle Chicken, and would do it again. There was a healthy helping of both home fries and black beans and the cool guacamole was a good contrast to the heat of the rest of the dish.   I only ordered coffee, but I did try my fiance's chai latte, which was to die for.  The atmosphere was cool. A lot of local art, memorabilia and knick-knacks.

Cute place with good food but slow service. Went in on a Sunday morning at 9:00am to a bunch of open tables but by 9:30 the place was filling fast! Sat for a few minutes before being helped but our sever brought waters right off the bat so all was good. Ordered a latte which took about 15 minutes til it got to the table, next time I'll stick to black coffee for simplicity. I was really craving some coffee and was bummed with the wait. Ordered the Belvedere omelette with herb potatoes, a biscuit and a side of well done bacon. There were 5 of in our party so not sure if that caused the wait, but it was at least 20 minutes from ordering to plates on the table. We were all soooo hungry and very happy to see our breakfast! The omelette was really good, very goat cheesy (which I like) and the potatoes were awesome. Biscuits are buttery and my bacon came out normal (not well done) but it was at least crunchy so all was good.  Overall I liked this place and would return but will try different timing so the wait for food isn't too bad. Prices not horrible, but not cheap. Omelette meal, added side of bacon and latte with tip was $22.

It took 35 minutes for our food to show up, and alas, it was cold... with gross soggy potatoes. Feel like we wasted our money. The restaurant was not busy, so we weren't really sure what the delay was. It looks like Zada Jane's is kind of going downhill and I hope the owners take note. With so much great competition in Plaza Midwood restaurants cannot afford to let things like this slide. Disappointing experience and I don't think I will be returning unless this issue, which looking at the reviews is common, is resolved.

One of our favorite spots in the neighborhood, we go at least once a week.  Sit at the bar for the best service and the most fun, especially when Jodi is working!  But not on Thursday, that's my day and we'll have to talk if you're in my seat!  Seriously, the food is great, staff is wonderful, we love it!

My husband & I were visiting Charlotte for the first time and my sister recommended Zada Jane's for breakfast. Everything was excellent, especially the roasted spuds and biscuit with the mixed berry jelly! We were in town for 5 days and ate here 3 of them. It was so good we figured there was no reason to try breakfast anywhere else.

I had brunch with a friend this morning. Waited 20 minutes for a table upon arriving and was then seated. We both ordered full meals and coffee/lattes. After finishing our food, we continued to talk and drink our coffees. Our waiter was very much present while we were eating but disappeared after dropping off the check (and never filled up waters). After 10-15 minutes after getting the checks (still drinking coffee) we were asked to leave because they were on a wait and needed the table. I found this incredibly rude. Furthermore, it wasn't even our waiter that told us, he told someone else and had them come ask us to leave. This left a sour taste in my mouth for sure. I won't be going back to Zada Janes for a long time. Plenty of other brunch places that appreciate their patrons - and are respectful. As far as the food, my eggs were over cooked and the fruit was just ok (soggy melon, strawberries and grapes with tops/stems still in place). A disappointing experience. Will visit Jack Beagles, Bistro La Bon or other local spots before going back to ZJs.

Two of six in our party headed here early to put our names in on a 45-minute wait for Sunday brunch. This was a smart move on our part! There's a lot of reviews about bad service, but while our server only gave us the bare minimum of service (they were pretty busy), it wasn't BAD. The food was very tasty and the Bunny Rancheros was plenty of food to share. Add a TLC biscuit and you've got a great breakfast. We'll be back to the restaurant again, for sure, and will likely send scouts ahead of time again.
Good coffee, Great biscuits, great service.  They could use some sort of barrier to tone down the street noise

I'm a newbie to the Plaze Midwood area, but I have already been to Zada Jane's twice.  I refuse to go back, though.  The first time was a few months ago on an early Saturday afternoon.  It wasn't that busy, so there were only two servers.  Service was semi-prompt, nothing too worrisome at the time.  What stood out most was the server who acted like she did not want to be there.  She wasn't exactly rude, but she was a downer and really killed any vibe of having a good experience.  They also couldn't make an iced coffee.  Seriously?  No ice cubes?  Whatever, I moved on and ordered lunch.  It took almost 30 minutes!!  The food was decent, which is why they get 2-stars instead of 1-star.  My friend came into town and we decided to get breakfast on a Tuesday morning.  I decided to give it a try again because they had good selections and it was close.  We walked in and told to seat ourselves.  Then we waited.....a long time.  It was almost 10 minutes and nobody even came to our table.  No menus.  Nothing.  My friend agreed that it was ridiculous and we took a couple minutes to look for other places.  In that time, nobody still came to our table.  We got up and started walking out when the woman behind the bar saw me leaving.  I shook my head at her and she didn't even say anything.  She just let me walk out.  That woman, by the way, was the same woman who was a debbie downer the first time I was at Zada Jane's.  I think she's the owner, but I think she should take herself off the schedule or become a silent partner.  In the end, I don't ever want to go back to Zada Jane's.  I truly think it is managed poorly and until that leadership changes, I urge you to look at other options before going in there.

We have been to Zadas a few times now on Friday and Saturday mornings and it gets better every time.  The Hasher is phenomenal, great coffee and service.  Also the biscuits with the jam they have on the table is great.  All around excellent.

Our first but not last visit to Zada Jane's.   Our party of 9 had an enjoyable meal with both good food and service.   We had 2 join us late and their food came out within minutes of the first order.   The staff was very attentive, coffee was always topped off, table pre-bused.  The owner was incredibly nice, giving my wife, whom she never met, flowers for her birthday.   Sadly we missed out on seeing our old friend Don Chef.

My Husband and I love this place. The food is consistent and the service is great. If you're looking for an upscale, clean cut hole in the wall, this is not your place. I always get the Zada Jane Basic breakfast and my husband loves the Bunny Rancheros. They have great biscuits and the Apple butter and berry jam is amazing. When it comes to dinner we always love the Ashley Farm Free Range Chicken. If they ever have Pistachio cake for dessert, get it, seriously.

My hubby and I was in the neighborhood after dropping our pup off at the local grooms, and wanted to grab a not to rat. After checking yelp for the local restaurants, we decided to go to Zada Janes because my husband is a big omelette fan and he especially love the build your own.  So we pull into the small ten car only parking lot which could be a pain which we realize when it was time for us to leave. Someone parked right behind us, so being the great driver that I am, had to maneuver my way out of the space. FYI, back in to the parking space instead of pulling in.   The outside of the building represents the neighborhood very well, very hip and artsy. Also the inside have local artists work, which keeps u intrigue while waiting for your food. It was semi busy, right before the noon lunch crowd. Server was nice and polite and helped us will some of the ingredients, but a little standoffish.  Anyway we both ordered build your own omelettes, his with hashbrowns, and mine with a biscuit, since I wanted to try the apple butter that heard about. Receive meal 20 mins later and was surprised by the size of the omealette. It looked delicious and was good too. My hubby, the omealette conoseiuer just thought it was ok, average. Hashbrowns were average in my opinion though.   I would definitely go back, if in the area, but I wouldn't drive across town to get there.

We wait for two hours today for brunch, first 45 minutes for a table which I know wasn't anyone's fault, they were just busy. But the next hour and a half I have no blues who's fault it was.. we had to ask about our food then it suddenly appears and it's cold!!!!!! We had a party of six two left without eating. The other four ate but one order was wrong. We go monthly to different places for brunch this was by far the worst experience yet! Will not be back.

Zada Jane's has SUCH a great vibe!  There is original artwork covering the yellow walls (most is available for purchase), the front entry is papered with flyers advertising the goings on in CLT, and the waitstaff are all funky, friendly and fun. Ask for Steven who is knowledgeable, super attentive and warm.  The food is good too! They serve breakfast all day so its all I have ever ordered. The bacon is delicious and always cooked perfectly. They also have plenty of vegetarian and vegan options. I highly recommend the East-Western, a curry infused scrambled tofu dish with peas, mushrooms, spinach, and onions. Incredibly flavorful. As for sides, the sweet potatoes are delicious, spiced with cinnamon, maple syrup, and other goodness!   Zada Jane's has an awesome outdoor patio where you can often see people drinking mimosas or Bloody Mary's with their dog leashed next to them.  The only reason I gave Zada Jane's four stars instead of five is that the food can be a bit inconsistent. I have eaten there many times and some days the food is better than others. What keeps me coming back is the ambience and service. My boyfriend and I can spend three hours here on a weekend morning, and even if its busy they never rush you to leave.

If you are looking for a healthy option on a beautiful day, I would highly recommend the patio at Zada Jane's!  All of their salad dressings are homemade and delicious, and I would also recommended the nachos and bloody marys!  Great location, great food, great price!

The food is always good here. Pricey but good. The service; however,  has taken a turn for the worse. Having a waitress push past us to get in the door before us and then letting the door close in our faces instead of holding it for us,  sitting for 15 minutes better anyone came over to get our drink order, and then another 15 before coming back to get our food order, is being ridiculous. Waited 45 minutes for  food to come and they are not busy! This place used to be an awesome place to come for a special treat,  but lately,  the service is making it not so special.

Fantastic breakfast and lunch. Big portions and lots of options. Service is great and fast. Casual atmosphere with funky decorations. Parking can be tight but worth it. Creative combinations and flavors for breakfast food, not just your standard entrees.

Are they always perfect? No, but who is. They are a little quirky, a little whimsical, & have fantastic dishes! We've eaten both brunch & dinner multiple times and absolutely love Zada Jane's for exactly what it is...and on their terms. If you appreciate and like to support local, independent businesses who are doing their thing and doing their thing well, you'll love it as much as we do. Cheers!

Heard great things about this place until I stopped by on Sunday. Service was extremely slow, I sat at the bar and it seemed whenever I asked for something I was being inconvenient. Ordered a $9.70 Grande Breakfast and was overcharged twice, a total of $5.50 for the protein, meanwhile the protein is already included, according to their shady menu. When I questioned the server/bartender about it, she seemed lost and said that she had mentioned at first (SHE DID NOT). I have no problem paying for something but don't be a wise ass and try to steal from people. This was rude and unprofessional, a simple 2 eggs with a side of some nasty sausage and a coffee was $18.65. I will make sure to NEVER go near this place again.

This morning I was up early and decided to treat myself to brunch I settled on Zada Janes which is located in the trendy neighborhood of Plaza Midwood this place is extremely popular b/c I waited about 20 minutes before I was seated and another 20 minutes before my food came out. I decided to try the "basic breakfast" I chose the eggs, soysage, whole wheat toast with a pancake, with sweet potatoe bites I must say that it was delish. The serving size was just enough to fill me up without being too full the waitress was also sweet and attentive. The only cons to this place was that there was no organization as far as checking into this place for brunch and the wait was a bit long other than that it will become a regular spot for me.

I have no idea what the hype is all about. I have seen long lines outside of this place all the time. One day I was invited by some friends to try it out. Wish I was never invited. I got an omelette and the meat was burned and not very hot. The breakfast redskin potatoes were luke warm also. I wish the food wasn't so bland.

I've been here a couple of times for breakfast and have found the food to be just OK. However, I do appreciate that they utilize local farmers and produce for their meals.   The place is pretty popular so expect a wait if you arrive after 9:00 a.m. on the weekends. They do offer coffee while you wait but I'm just not a big fan of their coffee. On my last visit (which was in Oct 2013) I ordered the blazing saddles omelet with biscuit and sweet potato hash browns. The biscuit was pretty dry and the sweet potatoes were a handful of cubed sweet potatoes. The omelet was a good size and was the best tasting part of the meal.   I'm willing to try other things on the menu but don't have high hopes. There are many other options for a solidly good breakfast in Charlotte, I wouldn't put this place on the list.

Let me start by saying I LOVE this place for breakfast.  As others have stated, the atmosphere is funky and eclectic, and the servers are laid-back but attentive.  If we're talking breakfast, ZJ's is definitely 4-5 stars.  But I'm talking dinner today.  Sigh.  We visited Zada Jane's for dinner last night, and it was much calmer than it usually is for breakfast.  We were greeted and seated immediately, and upon reviewing the menu, I was a little disappointed.  It's primarily $7-$10 sandwiches/wraps, and entrees that cost wayyyy more than you'd expect.  To me, ZJ's has a cool diner atmosphere, yet their entrees were $15-$28 for dishes like spinach ravioli and chicken.  Yowza.  I was also keenly aware of the 90 sanitation rating when choosing my dinner.    We settled on the fried squash and zucchini cakes for an appetizer, and they were absolutely delicious, as was the tangy tzatziki that came with them.  I got Carmen's Spinach Salad for dinner, which was solid, and my fella got the Druthers Chicken sandwich, which he said was okay but a little bland.  All in all, you couldn't keep me away for breakfast, but dinner?  Eh.

Most of my family lives in Charlotte so every time I come visit from Chicago I make them take me to their favorite places to eat. This little restaurant is very quaint and eclectic. They staff is very friendly as long as you are perfectly happy with whatever their menu has. Trying to add or leave off something from a meal is considered almost sin.   Its definitely the neighborhood hang out so don't expect to have service that quick or food that is warm every time to you come. Expect a casual, laid back experience.   I had their veggie sandwich and "forced theM" to add turkey. Which I might get shunned for every time I go ... the sandwich was amazing however. They also serve breakfast all day long and it all looks good!  I recommend checkin this place out ... have a drink with some breakfast, lunch or dinner and simply enjoy the outcome!

First time here and I'm not sure I will be back.  The service has been the worst I have had in Charlotte. My veggie sandwich was good, but my sweet potato browns were cold. My dining companion ordered the burger, med rare.  The burger was so well done it was dry and unappetizing. Our waitress never came back to check on us and since we were on our lunch break we ate our food even though it was not good.  I really wish properly trained staff was more important here.

I was visiting Charlotte for a mini vacation to visit a good friend who recently moved to the city. She heard about the brunch scene and really wanted to experience it. So after some research and reading reviews about Zada Jane's and looking at the menu we decided this was the place. My major turning point for selecting this place was because of the menu. It is different and that is what I like. (P.s my review and D G's are very similar because I am "the friend" in hers... hehe)  As mentioned, breakfast/brunch hours there was a long wait. About 25 minutes, so my friend and I took a stroll to the bakery down the street. After our stroll back, it was about our turn. We were seated at the first available spot, the bar. I typically avoid bar service because a. I cannot people watch, b. the seats are not so comfy, and c. it is hard to converse with the person you're with. Alas, I gave in because of hunger and said please, seat us anywhere.   Service was great. Typically you would think bar service when it is so busy isn't so great. Our guy was friendly, prompt and attentive. Our food came out within a very reasonable time of order. I was very satisfied.  Food- I ordered the Booker T which is sweet potato home fries with 2 eggs with local pork sausage cooked and placed atop of it with a homemade biscuit. Portion size was good, especially it being local eggs and pork. Overall flavor, I enjoyed the sweet potato home fries, my only gripe would be while seasoned well, I wish they were cooked a little bit more so they had a little bit more texture. It was just mushy, not even a little bit of crunchy caramelization of the sweet potato. The egg sausage was cooked to my liking. I like them JUST done, as in still soft and fluffy, but not wet. This was a godsend to my picky way of how I like my eggs cooked. My friend got essentially the breakfast salad with bacon, an overeasy egg and biscuit. The bacon was perfectly crisp, not greasy, and the greens very fresh. We were both very happy with our choices. We both had leftovers. For me, that is unusual. So that shows how filling the Booker T was.  Overall, if I visit Charlotte again, I'd go back to Zada Jane's if I was looking for not your typical brunch fair. I did not find pricing to be really overpriced. Besides, if the food is good I take no issue with paying a little bit extra. Also, the fact that they use local ingredients is always a plus to me.
Went for Sunday brunch. Food and service were great! I just wish the place was a little bigger. But over all this is a great little place to go!!!!

I usually think a long wait time means great food (because why would people wait for crap?) but I was wrong. We, a party of 4, waited for about 20-25 minutes. I ordered "the gobbler" sandwich with a side of roasted potatoes. The bread on the sandwich was stale and really dry. Super terrible. But even worse were the roasted potatoes. They were, without a doubt, cooked one day, refrigerated and microwaved when ordered. They had a dry, bouncy sponge texture. Really terrible. The passionfruit tea was delicious though. And the service was not bad either. But I will not go back and will not recommend.

Zada Jane's is a great option for a healthy meal out! I usually get a basic breakfast plate (eggs, bacon, sweet potato hash browns), and sometimes treat myself to one of their yummy gluten free options, such as toast or pancakes. The only downsides are the small parking lot and the slow service (service seems to be a problem more with the kitchen than the wait staff). If you are in a hurry, you'd probably want to try a different restaurant.

Delicious food. breakfast all day. Tasty loose leaf teas. Indescribable jams.   Inside and outside seating. Outside is very dog friendly.  Corn hole and shuffle board.  What's not to like?  Only 4 stars because the food took a long time to come out.

Talking about Zada Jane's is like talking about my Mama. She's wacky, wonderful, generally lots of fun, but a little inconsistent at times. I love to go here, sit on the patio and nosh on a big honkin' Bunny Rancheros egg-stravaganza and have the fluffy homemade biscuit smothered in local apple butter for dessert. They make a mean Bloody Mary, too. There's always good rock and roll music playing, lots of local color to enjoy, and a varied menu with something for everyone.   The biggest problem with Zada Jane's, as I see it, is its popularity. Because the indoor area is on the small size, inclement or cold weather can bring everyone indoors. It has also become a destination spot for Sunday brunch, so the wait is long and service is slow. If you're chill, however, there's nothing homier or more welcoming than a visit to ZJ's. You'll leave with a full tummy and a head full of good karma.

I highly recommend their breakfast. I had the vegless avenger, which was amazing, but even more so, was the very best grits I've had in my entire life (and I've had my share of grits). Wonderful food, and great service.

Ate at Zada Janes last night with a group of girls.  The food was fabulous, our waitress was fantastic and the drinks were flowing. We had  the best time.  I can't stress how wonderful the food was.  Highly recommend Zada Janes!!

This is by far one of my favorite places for Sunday brunch.. or Tuesday brunch for that matter.  I love the fact that they always have breakfast no matter what time of day, but of coure, what tops it off for me are the gluten free pancakes.  These aren't dinkly little sad pancakes either, they're HUGE and I don't think I've ever left Zada's without a to-go box.  The owner is also among one of the friendliest and most helpful restaurant owners I've ever contacted.  He was happy to answer questions about products that could contain gluten while showing interest in what exactly gluten was.  They even offer gluten free toast in addition to the gluten free pancake!  I usually go with the Booker T, but everything on the menu is delicious.

Zada Jane's, a neighborhood hotspot and with a fun, chill atmosphere, was an awesome addition to Plaza Midwood when it opened last fall.   Like most breakfast spots in Charlotte, there can be a long wait for a table on the weekends. The servers are friendly, but it can also take a while to get your food.  If you've got the time, it's well worth the wait.  Try the fluffy french toast topped with almonds or Bunny Rancheros, a combination of fried eggs, black beans and your choice of meat, topped with cheese, guacamole, salsa verde and cilantro crema, and served with warm flour tortillas.  Zada Jane's offers some great vegetarian options, which can be a rare find in Charlotte.   The patio is perfect for people-watching on Central Avenue and you can play shuffleboard outside while you wait.  I recently tried Zada Jane's for dinner. While the dinner menu is pricier and more limited, they also had some breakfast and lunch favorites available. I got the delicious veggie sandwich and my boyfriend loved the shrimp and grits.

This place was definitely popping for brunch....just packed with people which was the reason for our long wait. But nonetheless they did not disappoint. Our mimosas and breakfast were all really good. The inside isn't that big but there's a lot of patio space too. We'll definitely be back during the spring for that too. The wait can be a little frustrating but it was definitely worth the wait. This place gets my brunch stamp of approval lol

NOT RECOMMENDED.  We waited about an hour and a half for our food, after waiting for a table for quite some time.   Our server didn't refill our coffee or water unless we tracked her down and asked her. When our food finally came it was a mess. Nothing came out at the same time, two of us had to wait for 10 minutes while the other food came out. No apology, no explanation, nothing. Service was less than adequate to say the least. After all that, breakfast tasted like nothing.  I would have given this place one star, but the decor is fun and sitting out on the patio was nice. My husband liked his sandwich, the rest was Blech.  I definitely would NOT choose to go here again, and I would not recommend it to others.
Not many options for breakfast in Charlotte but this place saved the day while on tour here. Great food and service. Get the Bunny Rancheros. Worth the cab ride out

At this point the food can be the best ever but the service is ridiculous. We've been sitting her for almost 1.5 hours waiting on our food! I just cant understand why. Im asking to speak to management. Service this slow only leads to a snowball effect of extremely long wait times for a table. If I wasnt starving I would just walk out!

Cute little spot in plaza midwood.  Great outside patio for a sunny leisure day while inside is colorfully decorated.  Definitely a place full of regulars as the staff greeted people with hugs and a quick convo of catch up.  The menu seems to feature more of breakfast/brunch but they definitely have salads and sandwiches to offer as well.  I had a focaccia sandwich piled high with mozzarella and fresh veggies with a side of black eyed pea salad.  Very tasty!  Not the cleanest feel in there but I would definitely go back!  Rating was 95.

OK, so the food is good, as far as eggs and sausage and the like can be good... too bad the service is consistently horrific. Did I say horrific? I am being kind!  The wait staff moves around like bohemians on Quaaludes. Slow is an understatement. Seriously, they are too cool to care but don't even realize it. Zombie-esque really. Be prepared to wait for a table and then wait a ridiculous time for your food and then hope it's not cold or brought incorrectly, or worse, with hair on the plate! While you are waiting, make sure not to ask your server for a refill on coffee because it will never arrive, unless you get up, find her, ask again and then hope she remembers!

One of my "go-to" spots for brunch.  My favorite is the Booker-T: sweet potato hash browns covered by frittata-style eggs & sausage which is smothered in melted cheese & green onions, biscuit on the side.  Yum!!  I've also enjoyed the unique quesadillas on occasion.  The interior is small, so plan to wait a little on weekends at brunch (especially in cooler weather).  The decor is funky and chicken-focused.  Great place!  Strongly recommend.

Found this place while we were driving through town, the atmosphere of the restaurant is very cheerful. They got nice outside sitting and some games going on while we were there on a Saturday morning. The menu itself is kinda boring tho, for the omelette, they got either all meat or all veggies, but I LOVE they have the "build your own omelette". I am always changing something in the menu, so what's better than building my own, right? We wait quite some time to get our food, and I thought it was just "ok". The flavor was good, not too slaty, but it was way too greasy.

When this place first opened, I tried it once and wasn't too crazy about it. But a few months ago, I started eating breakfast here, and now it's my favorite morning spot. Good, strong coffee and delicious menu options. Now, their gravy is not so great. It's vegan, I think, and taking that into consideration, it's pretty good (and after all, they've really helped me with my biscuits & gravy addiction). You can put together any kind of breakfast you want a la carte, or they have some really tasty plates and omelets to choose from. I tried the Bunny Rancheros this morning, with sweet potatoes instead of the usual hash browns - mmm-mmm, good. I sat on the patio with my dog, and the hostess brought him a bucket of water right away - dog-friendly is always a good thing in my book. There were at least a dozen of us already waiting when they opened for Sunday brunch at 9am, so be prepared to wait for seating on the weekends.

Ya' know when you experience a restaurant environment at the perfect time? The ambiance fits your mood, the wait staff is great, and the food is even better?   That just happened.   I'm here on a bustling Sunday morning with my laptop at the bar. As I look around, literally everyone is smiling, including the wait staff. You can tell they love working here, and it shows.   Being a bit of an espresso snob, I was a little hesitant to order it at a restaurant like this, but I was not disappointed. My 4-shot iced espresso is fabulous.   I noticed the person next to me had a huge plate of goodness: Potatoes, meat, over medium eggs, guacamole, sour cream, tortillas... I knew I had to have it. So I ordered the Bunny Rancheros... and I haven't looked back since.   The guac is fresh, the chorizo has a complex depth of flavor, the over-medium eggs are cooked to perfection, and they even have the best hot sauce in the world already on the table: Texas Pete.   So, here are some things that would usually bother me if I was in a terrible mood. The parking is scarce- in fact, I just turned around to make sure they weren't towing my car because of my awkward parking space. It's busy and it's loud- so if you're trying to have a quiet, intimate conversation, this isn't the place.  The service does take a while, which would usually bother me, but each bite made up for each minute I waited. I also rarely ever spend a good $12 on a coffee and breakfast--I author the website BROKE & Healthy--but trust me when I say that it's worth your money.   In my opinion, Zada Jane's has lived up to the hype.

I go here often and I love the fact that they offer healthy, vegetarian and alternative items.  I love the "Bunny Rancheros" which is an omellete with guacamole, sour cream, black beams, salsa verde and potatoes.  And their apple butter and berry homemade jams are delicious!  The only thing that I dislike is the fact that when I come here on Sunday for brunch there is an hour wait.  Oh well, doesnt stop me from loving Zada Jane's!

I went on Tuesday for brunch to celebrate my birthday with friends and got absolutely terrible service. One of the waitresses (with a broken arm) was extremely rude to us, we had waited about 20 minutes, going in at least 3 times to check to see if anyone was going to serve us & All of the workers made it seem like it was an inconvenience for us to be there because a server called out or something. The food was good, but I got the green salad, which was supposed to come with potatoes that I didn't get. I was so fed up with the service at that point that I didn't bother to say anything. Get your food to go because you'll probably get crappy service here! I'm a waitress at a restaurant so I understand being busy, but it was completely unacceptable and I probably won't ever come back to dine in.

Excellent place for brunch and lunch! This is one of the better places in Plaza Midwood to get food. They offer vegan plates for those that stay away from animal products. Plates are big and hearty no matter what you order. The biscuits are not the greatest but overall the food it is wonderful. A lot of their food is organic and local which is evident in the quality. I would recommend Zada Jane's to anyone visiting the neighborhood.

It's one of the newest spots in the Plaza-Midwood area, and I think it's a great addition. It's a little slow, but I've noticed that they are picking up the pace as they get more and more established. I think they might have been working out some of the kinks when it first opened.  Breakfast is great, and I also enjoy getting lunch from here. The hummus is homemade and spectacular, and I like the wide range of teas to choose from. There are tons of vegetarian options, which makes me happy (if a bit overwhelmed with all the things I can choose from. I get used to finding the one veggie possibility and ordering that one, so when there are so many choices, I'm sometimes flabbergasted.)  The atmosphere is bright and interesting, and the servers are really friendly.

This is a great location for breakfast/brunch, especially since they serve breakfast all day.  The lunch/dinner options look good, although I prefer breakfast any time of the day.  The portion sizes are good and I really like the prices.  You can get a good-sized meal for less than $10.  I would definitely recommend the pancakes.  Although they aren't super fluffy, they are very good.

I wanted brunch on a weekday, so I headed to Zada Jane's for the first time in a long time and it was absolutely delicious. My latte was on fleek. I had the Bunny Racheros with chorizo, only with scrambled eggs and sweet potato hash instead of fried eggs and home fries. It was amazing. I ate leftovers for lunch and if I had any more, I'd eat it again for dinner. Yum. :)
Zada Jane's used to be one of my favorite Charlotte restaurants.  The last few times the food has been so so.    When it's on point their breakfast options are great.

This is as good as brunch gets. Came here around noon after a long night of partying in Charlotte, and I was in the mood for breakfast food. I ordered the Booker 's East Side Hasher (for $7.95) which included 2 eggs cooked fritatta style with sausage mixed in. There was gooey melted cheddar cheese on top with some chopped green onions for garnish. This was all layed on top of a bed of sweet potato hash, and came with a biscuit on the side. WONDERFUL. This was exactly what I wanted.  I recommend sitting at the counter-- the young lady there was so pleasant, and fun to talk to. The atmosphere made me feel comfortable, like a place locals would go to often. Now every time I'm in Charlotte I'm going to have to come here for a meal. One of the best brunches I've had in my life!

Nice, neighborhood brunch place. Great location on a corner in Plaza Midwood. Cute, homey decor and lively atmosphere. Wait is a tad long, parking can be a task, service a bit spotty and prices a smidge more than I'd like.   Got the Booker T.'s East Side Hasher and it was yummy. That bed of sweet potato hash is super tasty and the frittata with soysage (soy sausage) is fantastic. This is where I discovered soysage and I am thankful.   Coffee is local and beats the socks off the crap I drink every morning, so yay!

I would say this place is a great place to have a nice dinner when you don't want to get all dressed up. I had the hormone free filet.  $22.   It was decently sized cut of meat that really tasted great.  The acorn squash side was awesome.  The fresh green beans were also great. My wife had the wild mushroom ravioli $16.  First thing she noticed that each ravioli was charred.  I think the cook had that planned because much of the food was charred (to me in a good way).   Her ravioli needed to have more portion size, she was still hungry after finishing it.

- Long wait - Rather rude wait staff - Overall service was not that great - Food was okay, nothing really special  The food is meant to be upscale, organic with a grungy kind of twist. I had the french toast, and it was good. My bread was burned. I was close to sending it back, but it didn't have a charred taste, it was just black. Yum. The chorizo sausage is where it's at here. You'll be burping it up all day.   The best part about this place is eating outside under the umbrellas on a nice day with your dog next to you (if you have one).  We should have gone to Vivace like we usually do. Much much better!  Not recommended here at Zada Jane's.

I popped in for a quick lunch and took a seat on the patio.  There was only one other table with people there, not sure how busy it was inside. I settled in, was greeted promptly and asked for my drink order.  Because of the time I had before an appointment, I decided to order the hummus veggie wrap.  They were so slow in getting it to me that I had to leave hungry.  I told my server I had to move on and asked for my tea to go.  I returned afterwards because it was close and by then I was really hungry.  I sat outside again and the wrap was good, with nice greens, roasted red pepper hummus and crisp veggies. The salsa was freshly made,   No one came to refill my drink or bring the check, so I got up and went inside to pay.    Bottom line, food was good and healthy which is what I was looking for but nothing that couldn't have been done at home.  Service was very slow and inattentive.  Don't go if you're in a hurry or high maintenance.

Took an hour to get a table, followed by an additional 2 hrs to eat and pay for our checks. When I asked to speak with the manager due to the disappointing level of service it took her nearly half an hour to come out to our table. The manager tried to make it up to our party with a "50 percent discount" yet our bill was only slightly discounted. Overall, good food, terrible service. In the end Zada Jones isn't worth the hassel. You will leave annoyed that you wasted half of your Sunday afternoon on brunch.

I have always loved Zada Janes.  Those in the neighborhood know that they have to deal with the hiccups in the wait list and you must expect to wait on weekends.  Having only been for breakfast, I always get the Booker T with rye bread.  I need to ask them where they get their bread - it is divine.  I am not a biscuit person but if I was I am sure these are great.  The mimosa is served for $11 bucks - covers an entire bottle of champagne and a pitcher of OJ.  YUM!  Super campy inside with local artists work, junk store finds and fun memorabilia.    There is free coffee while you wait (or other special coffee drinks at the coffee bar! probably not free).  Just be patient - what you get it worth the price and worth the wait.

Truly unique amongst Charlotte establishments with thrifted decor, bright colors and tattoo'ed waitstaff. You would almost think you are in Austin, Portland, or Brooklyn.  The menu is your standard diner fare, tweaked a bit. Veggie options abound (I love soysage).   The wait is long during the normal busy times, like Sunday morning or lunch time, and for good reason. The place is freakin' adorable.  One visit, during a particularly busy time, my party was given free Mimosas due to the staff needing to have us move tables. This earned my eternal gratitude.  It also seems to be highly populated by very fashionable and put-together women and hotty men. Always a plus.

Hippie food in the South almost never turns out well, so it's refreshing to find a place that nails it.  Zada Janes is totally eclectic; both their interior and their menu reflect the quirky attitude.  I love it.  We've only been twice on two consecutive visits to Charlotte, and it's fast becoming a must-stop place. Everything I've tasted, from their soups to hummus to salads, has been delicious.

I've had my eye on this place for so long! Finally been in here a couple times now, now that I'm new in the neighborhood and closer. Might just come here all the time! Ha.   -First trip: Easter Sunday morning like 10-11. Sat right away outside patio. Love that they have shuffle board & corn hole right out front to play. Let's be real, their whole patio setup is nice and that's why it's always poppin'! We ordered fairly quickly. Mostly breakfast foods, but they do have some salads. It was hard to choose but we ordered:  *Booker Ts sweet potato hash!* hands down my most favorite breakfast I've had, okay top five. It's basically this delicious omelette with sweet potato hash underneath. This combo is brilliant. It's tastes heavenly. Which brought me back to round two, see second trip ). $12 *hot central coffee for $3 with refills.  *side of turkey bacon $3 (yum) *carrot cake pancakes. Um yummy! Not as sweet as it sounds. Wasn't on the menu, was a special and cost $13...prob wouldn't have spent that much on pancakes had I known that originally. But was good, just not that good if you know what I mean.   -Second trip: Saturday morning like 10:30-11. Could not just sit outside, had to see host for all seating since they were even busier. Host said 15-25 mins. More like 35 so be prepared to wait to get seated. And also for your food! The first trip was 30 min food wait once ordered. Second time almost that long. *They go slow here, no rush, go with the flow vibes* but worth the wait if you have time to do so. Both times I enjoyed my food to say the least. (I had booker T for food, a iced latte second trip $4? Good!)   Love me some Zada Jane's. Prob gonna be my fav brunch in my new neighborhood. Thanks Zj

Went to Zada's when I was in Charlotte this past weekend.  It is a nice funky cafe with great breakfasts.  They have a version of huevos rancheros called bunny rancheros that is delicious.  I ordered the East Side Hasher - and it was yummy .  They serve sweet potato hash browns and have quick and friendly service.  If you are in Charlotte and looking for a good breakfast/brunch head here.  Make a reservation or arrive early this place gets busy and has a line out the door.
Love this place! I always leave full and with a to go box! I appreciate their options of non-pork breakfast items and the food comes out fresh and tasty.

Went there today for a simple brunch and took us (2 people) 25 minutes to be seated. After we were seated we ordered our food and exactly 1 hour and 10 minutes later our waiter told us that our food is almost ready. 10 minutes after that she said they are really backed up in the kitchen. Needless to say we spent a total of 2 hours in there and walked out with no food. We were extremely disappointed. Do not go here!!!

Put name in at 10:30, sat at 11:20...not a bad wait for Mothers Day...have waited longer here.  That is the expectation. We gat being said, we put our order in at 11:30...it's now 12:35 and still haven't received food.  EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED!!! Again we expect to wait but this is outrageous...over an hour AFTER placing our order.  Have been here and enjoyed it many times over the years. Likely to never come back.
The food is awesome. The service is spotty at times. Not the place to go if you are in a rush to be somewhere soon. Great if you have the time to sit back, eat good food and enjoy people watching.

You simply must try the pancakes! They are amazingly delicious and "light and fluffy" just as they claim.  I ventured to Zada James with three others on Saturday following a 5k. I was famished. I was delighted that we didn't have to wait for a table. I was not delighted that I had to move my vehicle from the Grease place across the street (they tow) and that Zada's didn't come with a whole lot of parking options (spaces, that is). However, after I was properly parked and coffeed up... I ordered the Basic Breakfast with pork sausage, scrambled eggs, grits (very very creamy) and the biscuit. Being a biscuit maker myself--I wasn't excited about THEIR biscuit, but it wasn't bad. Others at the table ordered the pancakes (DELICIOUS, I was sad I didn't order these but I did offer to finish off my friends--who let me, yay), the sweet potato hashbrowns (good, but SWEET--you have been warned), and the Bunny Rancheros (colorful, looked and smelled good, I didn't taste these but he seemed to enjoy his meal as his plate was clean afterwards...  I will definitely go back and try other things from the menu--especially some of their sandwiches and OF COURSE the pancakes! This place has outdoor seating as well as indoor in a very eclectically decorated space with colorful walls and really "cool" (ha) ceiling fans.

With Zada Jane's being one of the few brunch-type places in the Plaza Midwood area, this place always has a LONG wait.  It's not because the food is amazing, it's because the service is so slow...everywhere.  The servers are often nowhere to be found, and one time I sat at the bar and everyone was frustrated because the person assigned to this area would be completely inattentive for 15-20 minutes at a time.  It also took us about 45 minutes to get our food once the order was put in, which is way too long.  Then I got my Omelette (got the special of the day with buffalo meat) and it was pretty bad.  The eggs were beyond overcooked and there was literally orange grease all over my plate seeping out of the omelette.  I had them remake it and the second one was just as bad.  The first time I went, they also messed up my order and didn't give me a breakfast burrito.  I did have a salad there one time, which was good.  Maybe that's a sign that I should stay away from their breakfast food???  It's clear that the people are working hard (both servers and kitchen staff), but this place just can't handle the volume with the current staff.  I would only go here if you're looking to have an incredibly leisurely, catch-up breakfast with a friend and you're not in a rush.  A lot of people like this place, so I say give it a try!  You just won't see me there anymore...third time was NOT a charm.
Loved this place !!! :-) Fresh, organic even gluten free! You will have to wait for a table tho- totally worth it! Service is fast and the food is delicious :)

I like the location & idea behind Zada Janes.  But, why is the gravy different EVERY time I order it.  Consistency is important when you try to order something that you like & it comes out tasting totally different than the last time!  Also, they never change their menu!!!  They could have much better food.  This place is merely average...

Zada Jane's is an adorable neighborhood cafe.  I've heard about it for years since my sister and her fiance go there often for brunch.  They love it so much that they named their dog after it!  Well, recently, I finally got to try it out for myself!    Molly S. and I wandered in for some afternoon brunch on a weekday so it wasn't as busy as I bet it probably is on a weekend.  She ordered the Bunny Rancheros.  It seems that this is her favorite dish to order.  She also had a latte and the waitress was so cute when she said she tried to make a really cool design in it, but it didn't quite turn out how she envisioned it.    I ordered the Grande Quande which is the Basic Breakfast, plus one, big fluffy pancake.  What does The Zada Jane 28205 Basic Breakfast encompass?  Two happy eggs, choice of one protein, one carb, plus toast or a TLC bisquit.  Molly advised me right away to go for the biscuit over toast.  So I ordered my two eggs over medium, their Local Grateful Growers sausage, Sweet Potato Browns, and the biscuit.  The pancake was the perfect size and they got my eggs just right medium -- a little run, but not too much.  The sausage had a little spicy kick to it, but just right.  The sweet potatoes were good, but seemed to lack flavor so when heated them up at home later on I added some butter and a little brown sugar to fix 'em up.  The biscuit also seemed to lack some flavor.  I thought it was a little hard too so maybe it had been sitting out a while.  Overall, I was very happy with my meal too.    Our waitress was super sweet and friendly and the decor of this cafe is a delight.  I also love that they have local art for sale, a patio for when it's warm, and their own Zada Jane cornhole boards.  I would definitely go back next time I'm in town.
Hostess did a horrendous job seating people. People were pushing their way in and seating themselves. There was no order at all. We will not be back anytime soon. Hopefully it will be resolved.

Great local diner in Plaza  Midwood.  I was here for a late breakfast last week and loved the food.  The service once seated was absolutely great although we had a rough start.  I'm not going to grill the staff for skipping our name on the wait list because I know it happens and they obliged immediately once they noticed the problem.  I had a breakfast burrito full of delicious egg, sour cream, and spinach.  The biscuit on the side was a perfect companion.  I'm a fan.
Relaxing, has a patio, and the food is great! Need I say more?

It's love at first bite, and sometimes sight. (I met my fiancé at Zada Jane's 3 years ago!)   ZJ'a is the perfect chill getaway for brunch, lunch or dinner. The Bunny Rancheros are a must-try... roasted potatoes, over-easy eggs, queso fresco, guac, sour cream, black beans, and your choice of protein. Warm tortillas on the side with a mimosa or two. The mushroom ravioli is the jam too.   I've never enjoyed the Bloody Mary's here though.

45 MIN WAIT FOR THIS ?!? Please tell me the process in the kitchen ?!? Not eating this shit you guys can do better . Thanks for making this Mother's Day wonderful & you guys are not even busy so that's not an excuse   And tell your waitress to act like she likes her job or tell her to get her ass home and not to come in , having unhappy employees means bad experience granted you most likely won't respond looking at these reviews and you guys barley respond . But you have to fix this or it will get fixed also next time I order a tea take one sip tell the waitress I did not like it and exchange for a water don't charge me please thanks for ruining MOTHERS DAY FOR us !! good job guys

Unfortunately I have to give Zada Jane a one star. I was so excited about experiencing this place after my friends had been texting me all morning to join them for brunch. Though they had finished by the time I arrived I still wanted to give the place a try. After reading the yelp reviews, looking at al the yummy Yelp photos I as totally in!   After walking the Juneteenth festival I walked over and saw no one was sitting in the patio but there were LOTS of receipt books laying out from previous guest. {not good someone could have stolen these receipts and or cash if any were left. I use to work in finance bank fraud so my red flags went up}. I went inside to ask if they would be servicing the patio. The lady said yes and someone would be right with me, and that I could select and table I wanted. I did just that facing the festival.   After waiting for 15minutes and no one coming out I decided to go inside to see what the hold up could be. Just as I was walking through the door a server comes running out. Apologizing that she was just heading out. I said it was ok, and told myself I would stay and order because I was extremely hungry. She provided me with a menu and a glass of water. I asked if she could give me about 4minutes to review the menu and I would be ready. I SPECIFICALLY asked for only 4minutes because I was so hungry and it had already taken 15minutes for someone to acknowledge me. Another 15 minutes go by and at that point I had enough. I left everything in the table including the untouched water and walked away. Not sure how long after that it took for them to notice I was gone but. I'm truly upset I didn't get to experience this place. The reviews in here are great, my friends swear by it and the $14 bottle of champagne for brunch, and how the servers know who they are as soon as they walk in and fills them with drinks. So unfortunate that I did not receive that same service.
