I am stopping mid-meal to do this because I want them to get the credit they deserve.  Let's start with the ambiance:  this place is so laid back and welcoming. The patio welcomes dogs, kids, and a game of corn hole or shuffle board. The inside of the place is so colorful. Even with the 20 minute wait, my eyes had plenty to soak up. Even though there are a lot of colors, it's not overbearing. It's light and bright.  The staff is lovely and our server really understands her menu and how to describe their dishes. We chose our meal off her recommendations.  I'm going to be honest, the place could be awful looking and the staff could be crap, but I would come back for the food in a heartbeat. Today's special is a crab cake with tomato and aioli on a biscuit with a side of habanero grits. AMAZING. My guy got the Bunny Rancheros with chipotle chicken. I usually can't stand Tex-mex brunch items, but this changed my mind. The guacamole from scratch, the chicken, even the sour cream (I really can't stand the stuff) was perfectly balanced. I say they should have the guac as a side dish with some chips, so good.  This was the perfect start to our visit to Charlotte. We weren't even planning on going anywhere we couldn't take a short walk to because we're staying the heart of the city, but it was completely worth the short drive. If you live her or are just visiting, don't miss this place.
I went here for brunch and even though it took a while to get our food it was worth the wait! So good!

I've heard mixed reviews about this place, how the food was phenomenal but the service was terrible. Maybe I just went there on a Friday morning for my hangover food instead of Saturday or Sunday, but this place was INCREDIBLE! Jen, our waitress, was so on point. She made us laugh, took care of our service and always came at the perfect time. I will go here to have her as my server! The hunny rancheros were BANGIN! Can't wait to come back! Please show this to a manager or something, Jen deserves some credit!!!(I really hope that's her name lol she had bangs and dark ha

Had brunch here today with friends and family. The basic breakfast was great. I had the applewood bacon which I should have told the young lady to fix crispy. I have found many places here barely run it over the grill before playing. Everyone enjoyed the food and music. We will be going back fore sure !

The brunch here is fantastic. While the wait times (for table and food) are a bit extended, the friendliness and fun of the waitstaff make up for it! If you're in Plaza Midwood for breakfast/brunch, give Zara Jane's a chance!
Horrible service. Wish I could have given it a zero. We waited an hour for our food, no one addressed the wait and I was charged for something that never arrived.

We were in town visiting for a week and this was the worst breakfast we've ever had.    Service - Yelp let us down; don't trust the large amount of reviews for this place.  We were ignored when we walked in - one lady was taking a phone order, another lady looked at us but then walked away to enter an order into the computer, lastly the guy was too busy telling a story with other customers to stop and greet us.  We were unsure what the process was, there wasn't a sign saying "Wait to be seated" or a host station so we decided to just grab a seat and wait.  Keep in mind that there was 3 people working and 3 tables of customers in the building - 1 to 1 should be easy to manage.  The employees seemed to be having a better time joking with each other and telling stories than to help us.   Food - We ended up getting simple omelettes. When they arrived the eggs were overcooked and the meat inside was extremely overcooked.  The crumbled sausage was burnt so bad that it was black.  The plate was coated in grease from cooking.  By far it was the most disgusting meal we've ever received in.  The food was dropped off at our table by the person cooking it which shows that there is no quality check process is place.  Food was uneatable and service was unwelcoming.  1 star is being generous.  Don't waste your money on a business that doesn't appreciate the customer.

Before I hit the road on Sunday to return to the DMV, my friend and I stopped in Zada Jane's for breakfast. There was a 20 min wait, so we walked to a local coffee shop to burn some time. We were seated (inside) soon after we returned. The restaurant is quaint, but bright, and its motley decor adds to its Southern charm.   Soft spoken Steven was our server. He did a good job covering the featured items and answering questions.  We ordered a few things to assess the menu. My entree was the crab omelette with herb potatoes. We also ordered jalapeño grits. The potatoes were well seasoned and those grits were really good with so much flavor packed into that little cup. However, the omelette didn't live up to my expectations. The egg base was really thick and over cooked. Also, the Boursin cheese that adds the creaminess was not evenly distributed. That omelette could have been a lot better with a little attention.   My gf had this local favorite bookmarked for quite sometime so I was glad to try it out. Not sure when I'll return but it was a pleasant experience nonetheless.

This is my second time coming here and it's still as good as the first time. The inside is a little cramped but the outside patio is fantastic.   I recommend the omelettes. Some of the best I've ever had. As well as their herb gravy, order a side of it with your TLC biscuit.

I am not a breakfast person. Brunch, however, is a different story. Give me a yummy pancake and a mimosa at 12 pm and I'm a happy girl. I almost missed out on the deliciousness of Zada Janes brunch because when I first moved to Charlotte, I came here for dinner. I can't remember what I got or what it cost, but I remember that I hated it! So when  I went for brunch for the first time, I was hesitant. I am happy to report that I was wrong in my hesitancy!  I have only ever gotten the bunny rancheros with half chorizo and half chicken or the pancakes. I love, love, love it! My boyfriend loves the vegless avenger omelette and has never ordered anything else. On Sunday (and Tuesday, I think), wine is half off so we always get a bottle of champagne and orange juice to make mimosas.   There can be a long wait but it's always worth it. Servers are always nice. As far as brunch goes, I have zero complaints and a million compliments!

So disappointed in my first visit to Zada Janes. Upon arrival I went in to ask do I seat myself and the waitress told me yes. I found a nice little outdoor table and read my book while awaiting the waitress. After 30 minutes passed and no one had even given me a menu or asked was I thirsty I decided to go in. The waitress got an attitude with me and seemed very irritated when I asked was there a waitress available to take my order. She sends me back outside and another waitress comes and takes my order I then had to wait another 30-45 minutes to get my food which was only a small grilled shrimp Caesar salad. Which looked pretty good by the way which I never got to taste because as soon as I went in for a bite guess what I find?!?!! Nasty hair in my food!!! Can you say disgusted! Then went I went and showed the waitress she had the audacity to get mad at me like it was my fault!!! I have blonde hair the hair in my  salad was long and brunette!! How about wearing a hair net next time?!?! I'll never go back

i liked that they have the option to make your own omelet. the chipotle chicken was semi-dry; but lots of filling options  also got a biscuit which hit the spot  got to sit outside which was great w/ the nice weather and only had to wait maybe 30 minutes on a sunday for brunch  overall a nice place for a casual brunch

After my terrible experience at Showmars, we settled on this place for breakfast/brunch.  It's always packed and after hearing my friends rave about this place, I was excited to check it out!  They were just opening but we were seated right away.  The bartender has some life drama going on and proceeded to yell about it to our server who was waiting on us at the moment.  The food was good and I recommend you guys to try it.  I ordered the Bunny Rancheros and really enjoyed it.  Potatoes and black beans were a nice compliment to the meal.

Our server Taylor was amazing. Supersweet super accommodating I will be back I swear just for her. Got a half price bottle of champagne for mimosas which was a great deal. $11 for the bottle and got four glasses out of it. So if you plan to get more then to mimosas go ahead and get the bottle. Comes with the orange juice. The food took a really long to come out about 45 minutes but it was pretty good it was fairly busy but not that busy to wait 45 minutes to be honest with you and Taylor was so amazing I will be back just for her. And the patio or she's gorgeous. It was also nice to see if they let you bring your doggy only problem is that patrons bring dogs that are a little too in the space is not quite big enough for that I should probably accommodate those guests towards the outer seats.
Cool place, Great healthy food, spotty service

The food is AMAZING pancakes, chorizo sausage and eggs.  My friend had a dish that everyone at the table raved about.   The downside these folks are so darn slow. Do not come here starving. Oh and parking is a tool b

So Zada Jane's is all about the vibe. That is what sets this place apart from most breakfast places.  Be prepared to wait but there is coffee and mugs on the side for coffee lovers.   I believe it is good food but honestly having to wait that long it is not worth five stars for me. I think their kitchen is tiny or something because it just takes awhile. If you are having fun and not worried about time this is the perfect place for you . I would recommend going to Dish for faster and better food around the corner. The only problem is the hours are little different than here. Zada Janes you either love or not so much.   I would recommend it to people who haven't been ,but I am not like I need to go there right now kind of place. I guess it is unfair since I expect to go to a place where people are licking there fingers yelling 'girl I told you so'. Nevertheless , go and try it and let me know what you think about it too. I hope your experience is a great one!

Been here many times, the food is delicious, the coffee is even better, but it seems like everyone I go I end up waiting a long time for my food. Honestly it's probably because it's made fresh with great ingredients, but I do know I need time if I'm gonna stop there for breakfast. Have a biscuit!

Food FINALLY came out after almost an HOUR of waiting. It's good. But the long wait really put me off. Get more kitchen staff, newer appliances, something. I've never waiting so long for brunch. I don't even wanna eat anymore.

I've been going to Zada Jane's for years. I love their breakfast, but the quality has gone downhill. I had lunch there today and found two old grapes in my hummus... apparently they have some issues with cleanliness in the kitchen. The service was super slow too. I never thought that I would say this, but I don't think that I'm going back there. My long relationship with Zada Jane's is over!

Great find on Central. I was told this street has great food. My first stop was a winner. I experienced the veggie burger with sweet potatoes and a gluten free beer. Don't judge me! The burst of curry on my taste buds were rocking. My friend had salmon and Quinoa, which was delicious. I have been back 3 times since and will bring my family here today. I still need to try brunch. That will be next.

On a sunny morning their patio is the perfect spot to catch morning breakfast and watch people pass by. The atmosphere was eclectic and casual; a little too casual for my taste, the food came out very slowly from the kitchen- but fortunately we were on vacation and weren't in a hurry to be anywhere. The pancakes I ordered were nothing I would write home about- but they did fill me up. The sweet potato hash browns were delicious, though!

I've been meaning to go here for a while but when I'm usually in the area, Zada Jane's is an afterthought. Until I went yesterday, I didn't even know exactly what they served.  We finally go the opportunity to go yesterday. The first thing I noticed was that the decor felt a little forced. Kinda like it was trying a little too hard to fit in with the neighborhood. Secondly, this seems to be the hipster epicenter of Charlotte. I felt like running out and buying a scarf doing my hair in that flippy thing way the vocalist for that one band does on his pictures. But I digress.   The menu, at first glance, looked impressive but we eventually settled on a bowl of cauliflower and artichoke hearts soup. The soup was great and it came with some old school Wheat Thins Lance Crackers. The soup was amazing, creamy and hearty. But if I were to do a blind taste test, I would have said it was broccoli soup.  The Becky ordered the Green Mindmelt Panini which had roasted portabellas, zucchini, squash, tomatoes, spinach and mozzarella with a side of the sweet potato home fries. Although it was very messy to eat, it was delicious! All the ingredients went well and were nicely roasted.  I, on the other hand, can't say the same for my Turkey sammich. My sammich came with turkey, guacamole and sprouts. It was the most bland thing I've had in a while. The bread was so dry and stale I could't really down the bites I took. I didn't finish it, took it home, tried a bite a little later, and had to dump it in the trash.  Now, it's not that bad, my sammich was off but everything else was really good. My gripe was with our server. She started off great. She was polite and friendly and smiled a lot, etc. It was nice of her to remember to bring us two spoons for our shared bowl of soup. But towards the end, she just sorta disappeared.  The place isn't even that big for someone to disappear for what seemed like 10 minutes at a time. We wanted to get our check, we had to sit and wait for a long time just to see her and flag her down. Finally brought us our check, took me 10 seconds to take my card out and put on the tray but she was gone by then. We did not see her for another ten minutes. We just sat there with our check, ready to leave, but couldn't. At one point I wanted to just get up and find her. Eventually she came back around and she checked us out. Very traumatic event... haha.  I didn't care much for this place. It's not bad, just not my thing I guess.

I've always heard really good things about the food, so I decided to take my fiends that were visiting from Florida. Since my one of them is a vegetarian I thought this would be a perfect place. The food truly was great and everyone loved it, however the service was really disappointing. I'm REALLY easy to please, but I get really turned off when there's a lack of basic customer service. Our waitress Rachel was extremely rude. We were seated outside and when she came - there was no "Hello" or "How are you?" or even a smile. She asked if we know what we would like to drink after looking at the menu for only a few minutes. We gave her our drink order and after 5 minutes only 3 drinks came out (we were 4 people). After about 10 minutes she came and all she said "Oh you, don't have your drink. Do you know what you want to eat?" Then another 10 minutes went by just waiting for my drink without saying "I'll check on it" or "I'm sorry for the wait". It took 20 minutes to get the bloody mary only ... let alone the food. That was the last time we saw her for the day. She didn't bring our food, she went around other tables checking on them, but didn't even ask one time if we wanted any refills or how our food is or if we need anything in general. She wasn't even around for us to ask for our bill so we had to flag down a different waitress by the name Alexandra who was actually very sweet. We had a really bad experience and I felt bad that my friends who were visiting were getting such poor service from Rachel after I've been telling them how warm and friendly people are in Charlotte. It was my first time coming at Zada Jane's and the food was great, but because of the lack of customer service I don't think I'll be a returning customer.

How awesome to have such a fun breakfast joint in my hood!  Good food that you can feel good eating- organic and local.   I love booker t's hash. The pork sausage was amazing. And do yourself a favor and opt for the biscuit with jam   If you plan on going on the weekend, go early. The place fills up quick.

If I could add another half a star I would, because Zada Janes is a little more than just A-Ok. But I'm not a fan quite yet, and here's why: I'm not going to complain about the wait times, because like every other place that's small and popular, even Zada Janes has ridiculous wait times, especially on a Sunday at brunch time. It's a really cool looking place; colorful and lively. The ambiance is neat, the servers are friendly, the Bloody Mary looked fantastic (and I'm going back there, just to try it because I didn't the last time), the food however, and I'm talking strictly about the vegetarian food, was ehh ok.. We ordered three different dishes  - the east western (scrambled tofu in curry powder), the veg burger, and the No-Da salad. the salad was good, the tofu was alright - kinda bland, and the burger is not something I would eat again. It's definitely a place worth checking out, and I'm going to give it a second chance. This time I'll have the Bloody Mary, and try some of the non-vegetarian dishes, and then I'll come back and update my review.. or not :)
pretty damn good breakfast. amazing service, food is good crowd is nice as well. and they make a decent espresso. have been 4 times and never had a bad experience.

I'm not a vegetarian, but my best friend is. It's a good thing they cater to both. My chicken sandwich was amazing! The cheese had such good flavoring! My best friend got the veggie burger and it looked amazing too, made with lentils (one of my favorites). The staff were super friendly, the vibe was chill, the customers were even intriguing. I'm a super fan of this place!

Am I going to be the outlier here? I was so shocked when I saw that the overall rating of this place was only 3.5 stars. I began to doubt my choice to add this to the Sunday Brunch exploration list, but we went for it anyway because of a couple friends' recommendations.  There must've been some pretty grumpy people for all the 3 star reviews. I had an amazing experience here. Short wait (We were seated within probably 10 minutes of getting there), and we got a table outside in the patio filled with puppies and hipsters. Man, I adore Plaza.  Our waitress was kind and attentive. The manager came up to us about 10 minutes into our wait and preemptively apologized about the wait for food. It did take a while, however, because we were warned, I won't deduct a star. I get it, it's a popular place, kitchens get busy. I ordered the Booker T's East Side Hasher and it was fantastic. Sweet, salty, and honestly, super unique. I've never had anything like that before.  The lady ordered The East-Western, and loved it as well. We both got a side of their biscuit with herbed gravy (instead of sausage) and that was stellar as well.   The brunch prices weren't bad at all, we came out under $25 together. When you compare that to some other prix fixe places, that's impressively cheap for two. We'll definitely be back, but we have a couple of other places to check out before we start making second-rounds again!
Waffles were delicious and apple butter is addictive! We lived the eclectic collection of coffee mugs--like getting coffee at a friend's house.

Herb Sausage gravy and biscuits are out of this world.  Was anxious to try them because most places over do the herbs.  The atmosphere on a Thursday morning was very welcoming and enjoyable.  It's likely a zoo on weekends, but once you try you can see why.  Lastly, if you can, ask for Jody.  She was tremendous.
Love everything!!! Steven was an awesome server, great personality, amazing food, cool environment.
I've been here multiple times.  Breakfast/brunch is their speciality but I like the dinner too.  I usually get the ravioli.  Sweet potato hash is good too.  Outside patio is great on a nice day!

I've never left a review of anything. I've been coming to Zada Janes for years, since it's opened. The service has always been bad. The food, I've always loved, which is why I've come back. But after this past week I'm going to have to call it quits.   My husband daughter and I went for breakfast a few months ago and we're the first to sit on the patio, as it filled up everyone got their food before us, still no food, my husband asked for more coffee, the waitress walked in and out of the door completely disregarding his request, still no food, the waitress walked out of the door for the third time with a bowl of water for a dog.... still no food or coffee. At this point we got up and left, hungry of course and went to the drive thru at mcdonalds.   Last week, again first on the patio, with a friend this time who also says she's never had good service here and lives a block away. Again we were last to get our food, we ordered some sandwiches and we're at the restaurant for over an hour and half!!!!    The reason I won't come back, the nachos which I've always loved were sooo stale and the veggie burger which has always been my favorite was god awful with no flavor.   So save your time and money. Go to krazy fish or three amigos or even five guys across the street!!! You've got a lot of choice in this area.

I went to Zada Jane's with the husband for Sunday breakfast.  Before 9:00, people were lined up at the door.  It didn't take too long to be seated, and both hostess and waitress were fresh faced and cheerful.  The decor features bold, brash colors that one may have not thought to put together, but they work.  Brett got a large serving of blueberry pancakes, and an order of hash browns topped with egg and cheese.  So much food that he ended up taking some home, along with some from my plate.  I had The Belvedere, an omelet featuring mushrooms, onions and peppers, along with yummy surprise bites of goat cheese.  The plate also had hash browns, which were really roasted potatoes, perfectly cooked with nicely browned edges.  A biscuit arrived as well, which was a real treat for me since I consume little gluten.  The buttermilk flavor of the biscuit shone through.  I ate the whole biscuit with butter (bad girl)!  Our waitress was on the ready to fill our coffee cups, and the whole experience was completely happy. Our cat, Newman, approves of this review.  He lay on my lap and was in direct line of my hand brushing across his head as I typed.  Purrrrrrr!!!

This is a very sweet place. Great energy and people. Roger is very hospitable. The sweet tea is amazing as are the jams but the kicker for this vegan was the tofu scramble. It's the best I've had. EVER.  Thanks so much to Zada Janes!!

Mixed review on a dinner visit. One entree, mushroom ravioli, said to be delicious, but my entree, the meatloaf, quite the opposite. Probably made days ago- dry and unappealing taste and texture. Smashed potatoes were very good. Service was fine.   It was a weekday night and not too busy so the tired and dreary surroundings were noticeable. I noticed tears in the vinyl bench seat. Not an inviting place to eat. Would be better if eating outside for brunch on a weekend when one wouldn't see how it looked or just as a bar hangout when looks didn't matter.

This place is so good. They definitely give you a lot of food for your money. I had the east side hash with a side slice of amaretto french toast. My husband had the vegless avenger. Both were very good and very filling. We couldn't finish all the food. Definitely come on an empty stomach!

Had dinner for the first time there, I was pleased with breakfast and lunch in the past so I thought we'd give it a try after our big "Latino Rally" on Tuesday.  My Latina Sisters and I have a standing date to try new places once a month but this was an extra this month because of the rally. We ordered the Spinach Dip, Calamari and some lovely Shrimp wrapped in Zuchini for appetizers, all good but the Shrimp were cooked to perfection and stood out. As well as our generous cocktails of course. The Crabcake I never tasted because I was busy with my Riccota Gnochi, blistered tomatoes and Skirt Steak, it was all good but the steak was a tad too much for me. I rarely eat Beef unless it melts in your mouth, I do more seafood or chicken. The meat was a tad chewy and I was full, I took it to go and gave it away but it was flavorful. The service was great from Ms Tab, she was friendly and down to earth like most of their servers.

TERRIBLE SERVICE.  We sat outdoors on a Saturday morning, which I understand is a busy time. If you're that slammed or short-staffed, let me know. I worked in the industry. I get it.  But if you can't offer me water or coffee and I need to ask for it, give me a break.  We waited a full hour for two omelets with no updates on our order.  When it came time for the bill, our server didn't even have the decency to hand the bill to my husband, she tossed it on the table as she walked by.   Food and music was decent so that's why I'm giving them two stars.   To the owners, you need to give your staff some training on how to provide the service of waiting on guests. We will not be back to give this place a second try. Once was enough.

Tried Zana Jane's for the first time this past weekend for brunch on Saturday...WOW, what polarizing reviews this place has!  Fortunately, we didn't have much of an issue finding parking on the street and we only had to wait about 20 minutes for a party of 4.  It was beautiful outside so I truly didn't mind the wait!  The brunch menu was solid and reasonably priced.  I was looking for a protein-packed meal and found what I was looking for in moments...It was a huge frittata-style scramble with my choice of protein (I opted for the applewood bacon), sweet potato hash and it was served with one of their biscuits...it was all absolutely wonderful!  I literally ate every crumb.  Granted, we were coming in for a post-workout meal and I was super hungry so I don't know if my view was distorted a bit but I thoroughly enjoyed my meal.  The sweet potato hash could easily become addicting.  They have already made their way into a couple of my daydreams.    The service was just eh.  The waitress was slow, the food took forever to come out she botched our checks...but all is forgiven thanks to the sweet potato mash.  The atmosphere is fun, hipster and trendy--adorable place.  I guess as others have mentioned...just know before you go...parking sucks, the wait is brutal and the service may be slow..then you won't be shocked upon arrival and can hopefully just enjoy the sweet potato mash uninhibited.   I will no doubt be back..probably this weekend...did I mention the sweet potato mash?

I've only been here for breakfast, so I realize I may be missing some phenomenal lunch and dinner, but my breakfast was definitely lacking.  The service was great, the ambience is very friendly and I love the mixed coffee mugs, but what was actually on our plates could have used at the very least some salt and pepper, if not a whole flavor boost. I had the east-western, and I could pretty much only taste curry powder in the watery scrambled veggies. I knew it was just liquids from the spinach, but my dining partners were afraid I was eating very undercooked eggs. Unfortunately very bland for something that has so much potential... and it came with one slice of toast, I'm pretty sure any other restaurants' standard is two.  The booker t hasher was a bit better, but again only delivered hints of the expected flavors. The basic breakfast was just that, and eggs were cooked correctly.  With lines out the door every weekend I feel like I must be missing something, but maybe I need to try the lunch menu next time.

Wow! What a fantastic spot.   **Breakfast review only** [& I cannot wait to come back to try Zada Jane's for everything and anything else!]  My friends and I came here on a Friday morning for breakfast. We sat down right away, and the service was fantastic. Coffee brewed in house. Nothing too special, but something to wake up the taste buds in the morning!   The breakfast dish of my likening was Booker T's East Side Hasher. If you don't like cheese, this is not the dish for you. Make sure to opt for the pork sausage, it's a local vendor! This comes with a side of toast or TLC biscuit and you need to get the biscuit. Whatever you opt for, make sure to try to homemade jam, it is absolutely incredible.   This just might be the tex-mex breakfast place I was looking for right here in my neighborhood!

Zada Jane's was recommended to me by a Charolotte native that now resides in Seattle. So, when I flew to Charolotte to visit my bestie, I made sure I had breakfast here at some point during my trip.   As I sat outside of Zada Jane's in my rented Kia Soul, I anxiously awaited their doors to open. When I saw two gentlemen walk up to the entrance I shortly followed.   I was greeted and seated by a nice lady to which I immediately asked for a bloody mary because when you're on vacation, you get booze for breakfast of course! The bloody mary was nice and not too spicy. It complimented my Booker T's East Side Hasher very well. The Hasher came with a bed of sweet potato home fries (which were to die for), two "happy eggs" fritatta style (according to the menu) and your choice of Grateful Growers pork sausage (where all their pork products come from), turkey sausage or soysage (I chose the Grateful Growers pork sausage), then covered in heavenly melted cheddar cheese and sprinkles of green onions on top. You can then choose their TLC biscuit or toast (Duh, I ordered the TLC biscuit). Just writing this review tempts me to book a flight to NC to see my bestie again.... and Zada Jane, my new BFF.   My bloody mary was a damn good bloody mary. No frou frou bull crap in the garnish, just the essentials. It was a get-to-the-point bloody marry that went so sinfully well with my breakfast that I had "wished my bestie had called in to work that day and joined me for breakfast" good. The sausage from GG was just perfectly seasoned and complimented the sweet potatoes very well. The cheddar, well we are in the south y'all, was rich, very very rich and extra melty (grins from ear to ear aaaaaand now drooling). The happy eggs, let me just grab the definition off the menu, free range eggs. You can rest assured folks that your eggs were happy prior to them becoming your breakfast/lunch. No wonder I was pretty damn happy after I ate my breakfast! Also, even though the morning sky had overcast, my breakfast and my rental car, being a super bright yellow Kia Soul, brightened up my day.   Oh Zada Jane, why must you be on the other side of the country! I cannot wait until I make the trek out there just to come back and try your other offerings. As I sit here so early in the morning typing out this review and my stomach is so empty and hungry craving one of your sweet sweet breakfasts..... ok... on to southwest.com pronto!
By far my favorite place in Charlotte - the atmosphere is great and the food is amazing - never had a bad meal.  Try the Hummus Frummus Wrap - the hummus is amazing!

Small building not really a waiting area so you stand in the middle of the room which is awkward. GREAT food though! They were ok doing substitutions and didn't charge me extra.  The breakfast was delicious and they pride themselves on having different options for all kinds of foodies. Vegans, Vegetarians, health conscious... They also have a list of specialty drinks you can order and homemade jam on the table. I would go back there when its warmer so I could experience it with a little more room.

yum yum yum.  two fantastic charlotte friends took me here proclaiming - "you will love this place."  they were absolutely right.  this place has the potential to be the hipster diner of your dreams, only the staff are funny and sassy enough to not hate them.  we sat at the counter because the wait was crazy long for a booth.  the male counter server was hilarious and kept bringing me sweet tea after sweet tea.  the waitresses each had aprons made from old timey fabric, and not fabric that's made to look old timey.  you can spot a few hidden gems on the walls - framed johnny cash and a copy of herb alpert & the tijuana brass' whipped cream album are among the wall decorations.   i ordered the bunny rancheros with turkey sausage, which was delightful.  black beans, eggs, and salsa verde that my mouth still dreams of weeks later.  i could not eat this with the wraps that were given with bunny r; it would have been a feat too messy.

Tried this on my last visit to Charlotte and loved the place. There is character appeal, customers playing shuffle board out front and fabulous food. We sat at the bar and had good company with the bartender. I recommend the Sunday mimosa, but remember Sunday drinking times...excellent breakfast.
I went to Zada Jane's last year with a friend for lunch the food and service was good they had a diverse menu. We had a good time this is a keeper.

I was visiting from out of town and went to breakfast with a friend, a few days ago. It looked like a cute little breakfast spot, in a hip part of town, the food when it came out looked good, but as soon as I started eating, was disappointed. I had the two egg special (scrambled) with bacon, herb spuds and a biscuit with a side of gravy. My scrambled eggs were fine, although a lack of flavor makes me think they weren't fresh eggs, my herb spuds were the consistency of cold French fries and only lukewarm, again not flavorful, despite obvious herbs on them. These two things alone would normally make me think it might just be a bad morning for the wait staff and my plate had sat under the heat lamp too long. It was the thin, Jim Beam's-looking bacon that had crunch but nothing else and the bland gravy that made me think Zada Jane was all street appeal. The ingredients didn't taste fresh, the gravy tasted like it was from a mix (if it was from scratch the components must've been lacking to begin with), and the coffee was only, not-unbearable, on top of an unsmiling wait staff. Not sure Charlotte has anything better, so I might be back, but I won't care either way.

Went for lunch today. Server was so funny and upbeat, had a great time. My wife had a grilled cheese and soup and loved it. I had the Druther's Clucker and it was very good. Little pricey for lunch, but all was good.

There is probably nobody in town that won't tell you how hot of a breakfast place this is. You will probably have a wait of 30-90 minutes but it is some of the best breakfast food in town. We really love the huevos rancheros! BUT watch out for dinner the service and food were not what we are use to at breakfast! So basically breakfast, lunch, yes yes yes!! Dinner not so much,

Eclectic little spot here in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood. It absolutely has a cool vibe and interesting decor. Very... mingled.  I opted for the huevos rancheros and it was different than others I've had. More like an omelet with grilled chicken, black beans and pepper jack cheese, but topped with pico and sour cream. That's not what I was expecting but it was still very good.  My wife chose the frittata style eggs and didn't enjoy it much. She said that the eggs, with the melted cheddar cheese and the pork sausage, had the texture of shoes. Well, that was a bummer. But the biscuit was good with their table jam on it.  But with that said, we both thoroughly enjoyed the sweet potato hash.  So go with the sweet potato hash and you should be okay!

We've been Plaza Midwood residents for 13 years and have enjoyed supporting many of our local businesses. After years of spending many weekend breakfasts at Zada Jane's, we've finally had our last.   We arrived as one of the first tables on a Sunday. No wait for either inside of outside. It was still pretty quiet. Our family of four waited 45 minutes for our breakfast after ordering, while tables continued to be served who arrived and ordered after us. Once our food came I quickly discovered that my omelette was filled with goat cheese and asked them to remake it as I had ordered it - no goat cheese. Two different people asked me to remind them what I had ordered. 15-20 minutes later my family had finished eating when my food was brought. We asked to have it packed to go so they simply brought me a box. No real apology. No offers to make it right. No helping me pack up my breakfast.   I wish this was a one off but service has continued to steadily go down over the years and the neighborhood location can't justify such bad service.

Veggie heaven!   I got the veggie nachos (black beans, zucchini, corn, salsa, guacamole-no cheese) on black tortilla chips-yum! Also had the vegan soup and roasted vegetables. The variety in the roasted vegetables was superior! (Note: The black eye pea salad and roasted sweet potatoes are not vegan).  The service leaves a bit to be desired. Seemed as though one person was trying to do it all. Maybe hire an extra server for the place. The knowledge of the one guy doing it all was...okay at best. If asked a question he was always unsure but would happily go and check.   The atmosphere was delightful! Cute decor and fun music. Parking is limited and challenging though.   They have wine, beer, and coffee with many Torino syrups too. Their vegetarian and vegan items are fairly well marked and they even have gluten-free options. I would come again!

After always passing by because of people waiting outside to get in, we finally decided to wait and have a bit to eat over the weekend.  Overall the staff and service was friendly and warm. The food was good but nothing really stood out. They forgot meat in one of the dishes and kindly brought it out to us, but I'm not sure why this place is so popular. Everything seemed average to me and my husband. We can say we tried it, and I can leave it at that.

Zada's is great.  It has a sweet atmosphere with a lot of unique local art, a great menu and even better food.  The service is never fantastic, but for how busy they are- especially on weekends- I don't mind.  So I would suggest either setting aside a good chunk of time for b-fast or going in knowing exactly what you want.

The sheer number of reviews for Zada Jane's was enough to tempt me to purchase an online deal and venture into Charlotte for some good grub. It proved to be worth the trip as it proved to be a really excellent meal.   The parking was a little tight, and would have been harder to figure out had it been busier. We arrived at 6pm on a Saturday and the place was a ghost town, which suited us just fine. We got a prime people-watching spot on the patio area and it proved to make for an entertaining meal. The service was well-paced the the hipster waitstaff crew were attentive and friendly.  The beer selection is composed mostly of bottles, but they consisted of different microbrews which was a plus. After ordering our brews we got a basket of Kool Kip's Nachos...vegeterian style ($7.25) , for an appetizer. Despite the absence of meat, these were some of the best nachos I've ever had, and that says a lot. The roasted squash, peppers, onions and corn, topped with black beans, guac, and sour cream proved to be quite the hearty starter. The blue chips also made a for a solid mode of transportation for the nacho toppings. I would highly recommend going with a plate of nachos if you are grabbing a meal here.  For dinner I had the Braised Short Ribs ($19.95) and it was out of this world. Now I've been disappointed with dry, grizzly short ribs in the past, but that was not an issue at Zada Janes. These suckers were succulent, tender and delicious, and the portion was mind-boggling. I, Rob B, was only able to eat half the meal and took the other half home for a tastetacular leftover lunch the following day. These mighty short ribs came with these amazing mashed potatoes and cole slaw. Combining a bite of meat, potato and slaw proved to be pure excellence.   The missus ordered the Wild Mushroom Ravioli ($15) which she really enjoyed. I wouldn't touch those 'shrums myself but she gobbled them down. Her portion was also a bit much and had plenty of leftovers for the following day. The only downside was that the mushrooms were just too oily and rich...someone in the kitchen had a heavy hand with the oil. Hers came with a side salad which was really good for a side salad, with high-quality veggies. She went with the lemon thyme dressing and that was really a winner. If you get a salad here, give that dressing a whirl.  With all these good eats we simply had no room for dessert, despite how much we wanted to give it a whirl. Zada Jane's proved to be a really good restaurant and we'll definitely be back in the future, without the online deal.

Went for a walk in Plaza with my sister and her 2 year old when we decided to check this place out. I'd heard good things but wanted to see what was up.   The place wasn't too busy, seemed like a typical Wednesday crowd, however you could see how some people were anxiously awaiting their food.  Our 2 year old was asleep, so we figured we would give it a shot. Sadly the experience wasn't any different for us.   Server told us to seat ourselves and then they forgot about us. Got our own menu from the bar, so took about 15-20 min to put our order in and get waters.   We waited over an hour for a pancake, a cup of fruit, & a salad. We tried to cancel our order after my nephew woke up fussy and we had already been waiting for a good 50 min. As we made this request one server whispered to another and then another server came rushing out of the back with our food.   We heard multiple excuses about how some orders got mixed up and as well as the ticket printer wasn't working; however we weren't told any of this until after we requested for our order to be cancelled.   Future reference to this situation: Communicate this to your customer so they know what to expect and can level with you.   The boxed up food to-go got the stars in this review, the service definitely did not.

Went here the other night with the parental units. Absolutely loved their set up and the dog friendly patio a plus! Our waitress was very sweet and the service prompt.   Mom ordered the flat iron skirt steak sandwich--which is to die for!  The steak was so perfectly season and cooked to perfection. It as incredible.   I ordered the spinach salad and it was perfect. Watching my weight as summer is around the corner.   Unfortunately, my dad ordered the crab cakes... no bueno. They were fishy... not fresh. Too bad.... but we still will go back... just avoid the crab cakes.   Yum, can't wait to try their breakfast.   Cool and hip spot!

Our server was extremely funny and sweet.   I had the nachos...they were good! The amaretto french toast is amaaaazing!   My boyfriend had the Green Mile sandwich and it was probably one of the best sandwiches we ever had!
My new favorite spot for brunch! Great vibes, superb service and yummy food. The Bunny Rancheros are a house favorite and they are delicious. I will definitely be coming back!!
Awesome food and a great place to go on a weekend morning to chill.
Every time I visit Charlotte I want to come here. The food is outstanding, I can't think of a better place to go to sober up from the night before. I also love that every coffee cup is unique.
Really enjoyed the rancheros it was great! Also the pancakes !!! Definitely will be back. Great brunch place !

I have always loved Zada Jane's however I will not be returnung after today's experience. Took forever to get food Order was not as ordered They now serve awful biscuits and if you ask for what  they use to servce tbere is an upcharge Bacon was awful- they took and agrred to replace, but never brought it t back  Upcharge now for the famous orabge butter even if you order pancakes  Shared a table with two different groups and their orders were all wrong. SO  dosappoibted in one of my local hangouts- looking for a new brunch location.  .
Wednesday night. Nice summer night, sat outside. Had flat iron steak on pita w herb roasted potatoes, really good. Chill spot in an eclectic area. Great groupon choice. Weekends are pacled though.

I came here for Sunday brunch once with a friend and was pleased. I ordered the Booker T's East Side Hasher -- "a bed of sweet potato hash browns topped with two Happy Eggs frittata style with your choice of local Grateful Growers pork sausage, turkey sausage, or soysage,then covered with melted cheddar cheese and green onions - choice of toast or TLC biscuit." Damn good! The only reason I haven't returned is because of the long wait. I drive by with the intention of going in but see the long line and keep on driving to Dim Sum.

It was pretty busy inside so our group of 8 decided to sit outside.  I understand that it can be difficult to manage a large party, but our server seemed to not give a hoot about our table at all.  I had to go ask for silverware and unless we specifically asked to have our drinks refilled it was not done.  One of our group was completely ignored and ended up having to get her food to go. The actual food itself was okay.  I think the breakfast stuff seemed to turn out better than the lunch items with the exception of the fried potatoes which were still kind of hard.
They're lucky they've pretty much have no competition for breakfast or brunch. Food is solid, service is woof. Solid patio.

Food is great but a bit overpriced for what you get.  I have been a few times and have had several different menu items. I do love that they have Greatful Growers pork (all natural). I normally do not eat pork, but this stuff is really good!!! Latte's are yummy!  On the flip side....the parking, well...sucks..and there almost has always been a long wait and no where to sit...  We also have never had a pleasant visit as far as the greeting/seating staff goes. They seem to be disconnected from the patron's and really could care less...  Our server's have been kind though...so far :+)

The waitress seems all over the place and it isn't busy. She's not very helpful and I've noticed that she's only making sure all of her Caucasian customers are ok. This is my 2nd time here. The food is taking forever but I'm hungry and Patient. I've heard great things about this place so I'm extremely disappointed in the vibe here today

I have heard raving reviews for this place and was excited to check out what all the hype was about. We had a group of 4 and the wait was about 15 minutes on a Sunday around 1pm. Not a bad wait for brunch at such a popular spot! There was corn hole and shuffleboard out front to help pass the time. All tables on the patio had umbrellas for some shade and relief from the heat. I was excited to see that "seasonal" coffee flavors (i.e. gingerbread, pumpkin, peppermint, etc.) are served year round. Always added points in my book!   I must admit I was a little disappointed with my meal. I ordered a basic create your own omelet with turkey bacon, mushrooms, spinach and cheese. When my plate came out, I had an omelet with a TON (never thought you could have too much, but it was pushing it) of turkey bacon and cheese only. I was told that they ran out of spinach and mushrooms, but was not informed until I was served something other than what I ordered. I understand that later in the day you run the risk of running out of ingredients. However, you would expect the courtesy of being notified before they prepare your meal so that you can change your order accordingly. It was rather underwhelming.   Two of the others in our group had been before and highly recommended there. One had ordered a chicken sandwich that she previously had gotten and loved and was a little disappointed this time.. so maybe the restaurant was just having an all around off day. Another in our party got the bunny rancheros which they were very happy with. That seems to be their tried and true menu item. The biscuits and seasoned potatoes (side dish) were very tasty!

Very cool place!  Great location right off of central... and when it was as nice as it was outside like yesterday, it has a great outdoor eating patio.  Went here after a 4mile race, so naturally we were all starving so the service seemed a little on the slow side (or we were just starving and dehydrated)... it's all good though because it was well worth the wait.  I had the bunny rancheros with turkey sausage....  the food was too pretty to eat!  I got over it pretty quickly and devoured my meal in a matter of minutes.  Looks like they have really good biscuits here too - pair that with the local jam/jelly thats on the tables would be a winning combo.  I watched in envy as my friend ate 2 of those things in 4 quick bites.  Local art is displayed on the walls so it makes for a cool place.

ZJ's has great food. The outdoor seating is awesome. Playing corn-hole as you wait for the table is a plus. When you are waiting, they offer you coffee.  But, if you go on a weekend, you have to expect it to be busy. There are not many solid brunch places in Charlotte. So this one is popular. Plan on waiting 30-40 minutes. And the hostess we have mainly dealt with can be a bit...ditzy? I don't know. She is sweet, but disappears a lot... doesn't really know how to properly judge you wait time (we were once told 10 minutes when there were about 5 parties in front of us on a Saturday morning at 10. Nope). If you go expecting to spend a leisurely time... you are set!

Mediocre food and poor service (except the lady with the dreads - she is fabulous). First time I talked to the server about my celiac and he served me burned sweet potato hash with cheese that apparently had gluten. Second time I got some other mediocre food I can't even remember and the last time I got a mediocre latte from a brown haired woman who seemed annoyed that I couldn't have gluten and was much less friendly after I told her. She also seemed annoyed that we were sitting at the bar drinking coffee and only one of us was getting food (not me because I knew I couldn't trust her to put an order in with her attitude and my first experience at the place). Sorry to inconvenience you? Additionally, the place just seems dirty like they wouldn't do great on a health inspection. It's a bummer because it could be great if the staff wasn't so lame.

First time here. Full bar and tasty looking breakfast/brunch/lunch menu. Very chill vibe and the bartender Jodie was very very sweet.   Check out their hours. They are different on Mondays & Tuesdays as opposed to the rest of the week.  Will come back again to try the "happy eggs"

First time trying this place, arrived during a what seemed to be "dying down after a rush". However was very disappointed in the service of the staff. Getting seated right away was no problem, but the food literally took right at 30 minutes to receive our food! Coffee was weak not fresh, after ordering another beverage from the bar a "Bloody Mary" that took an additional longer than usual amount of time. The food tasted good however fail on the staffs side for not delivering the food and in forming us that one of the toppings for the dish, was out of stock, and if it could be replaced with something else! And yet an hour and something later here I am writing this and waiting on my check..... I give a service rating of 2 stars and a food rating of 3 stars!

So what's the big deal here and, based on the experiences I've had coupled with a lot of the other Yelp reviews I've read, how are they still open?  Cute decor? Definitely. Funky?  Certainly. Hip? I suppose. All that does not a restaurant destination make though.  The food sounds nice on the menu and the fact they are supporting local farms and growers is appreciated but the results are just so uneven. It tastes good but it's cold, it's hot but overcooked, it's hot and cooked properly but really doesn't taste quite right. It's perfectly prepared and delicious. Who can tell?  Add to that the fact that the front of the place is a disorganized mess and the staff is either surly or outright rude and condescending and I get back to my original sentiment. How is this place still open?
